0.title: Anne Heche was under influence of cocaine during car crash: Report
0.article_body: Actress Anne Heche, who is critical after crashing her car into a house in Los Angeles, was under the influence of cocaine during the accident, reported TMZ. The report added that cocaine and fentanyl were found in her system but the fentanyl could have been present due to the pain medication provided at the hospital. The accident occurred last Friday.

1.title: Team should revolve around Suryakumar, he doesn't need to be slotted: Rohan
1.article_body: Reacting to former selector Saba Karim stating that Suryakumar Yadav can be slotted at number four in India's T20I team, cricketer-turned-commentator Rohan Gavaskar said, "Suryakumar doesn't need to be slotted...This...team needs to revolve around him." "You've got to figure out where is the best you can get out of him," added Rohan. Rohan stated that certain spots are however "non-negotiable".

2.title: Paytm shares fall after advisory firm opposes CEO's reappointment
2.article_body: Paytm shares fell by 6.2% on Friday after the Institutional Investor Advisory Services India advised shareholders to vote against the reappointment of Vijay Shekhar Sharma as the CEO of Paytm's parent One97 Communications. The RBI's new guidelines for digital lending apps also drove the shares to decline as this could operationally impact its buy-now-pay-later business, Paytm told investors.

3.title: Man hides ₹43 lakh-gold in undergarment, held at airport in K'taka
3.article_body: Customs officials have seized gold worth over ₹43 lakh from a male passenger at Mangaluru International Airport in Karnataka. The man had put the gold, which was in paste form, in a white adhesive tape pouch and hidden it inside a stitched pocket of the undergarment that he was wearing, officials said. The accused had arrived from Dubai on Wednesday.

4.title: No parking at Delhi Metro stations from 6 am on Aug 14 till 2 pm on Aug 15
4.article_body: Delhi Metro Rail Corporation (DMRC) said that in view of the security measures for Independence Day, parking facilities will not be available at Metro stations from 6 am on August 14 till 2 pm on August 15. Metro train services will continue to run as per normal schedule, DMRC added. Notably, 2,000 live cartridges were recovered in Delhi on Friday.

5.title: Playing a mom won't take away my mojo, but I'd play my age: Mini Mathur
5.article_body: Actress Mini Mathur said that she doesn't know why there is "a strange backfooted attitude" about playing a mother onscreen, adding that it won't "take away [her] mojo". Mini further said being "someone's mother" is not enough and wants to do roles appropriate for her. "I would ask them to cast me for the age that I am," she added.

6.title: Xiaomi unveils humanoid robot prototype worth ₹82 lakh that can read human emotions
6.article_body: Xiaomi has unveiled a humanoid robot prototype, called CyberOne, which has the ability to read human emotions. It has a face in the form of a curved OLED panel and is equipped with two cameras, allowing it to perceive the world in 3D and recognise individuals. The 177-cm tall robot will cost somewhere between ₹71 lakh and ₹82 lakh.

7.title: I have no aspirations of becoming Opposition's PM face in 2024: Nitish Kumar
7.article_body: After being sworn in as Bihar Chief Minister for a record eighth time, Janata Dal (United) leader Nitish Kumar on Friday said that he has no aspirations of becoming the Opposition's PM face in 2024. "I will make an effort to see that all the Opposition parties work together. If they do, it will be good," he said.

8.title: Tried giving Civil Services Exam many times but kept on failing: Big B
8.article_body: Actor Amitabh Bachchan said he tried giving the Civil Services Exam "many times" after college but kept on "failing". Discussing his struggle, Amitabh had earlier stated, "There was a lot of rejection because everywhere I went, I failed to get a job...I was either not qualified enough or I was too shy." "[It was] terribly frustrating," he'd added.

9.title: End military activities at Europe's largest nuclear plant in Ukraine: UN
9.article_body: The UN Secretary-General Antonio Guterres called for an immediate end to all military activity around Europe's largest nuclear power plant in Ukraine, as Moscow and Kyiv blamed each other for renewed shelling. Guterres warned that any damage could lead to "catastrophic consequences" in the region and beyond. He called for a demilitarised zone to be established around the Zaporizhzhia plant.

10.title: Avoid large gatherings during I-Day amid COVID surge: Centre to states
10.article_body: Amid surge in COVID-19 cases across the country, the central government has asked states to ensure there are no large gatherings for Independence Day celebrations. "It's imperative that Covid guidelines are followed," Centre said. Further, the Home Ministry has asked all states and Union Territories to carry out a 'Swachh Bharat' campaign at a key location in each district.

11.title: 24-yr-old man swept away in Indore drain, body found 150 metres from site
11.article_body: The body of a 24-year-old man who was swept away in a swollen drain in Madhya Pradesh's Indore was found on Thursday. The man, Zakir Khan, had accidentally fallen into the swollen drain on Wednesday when he was trying to stop other people from entering the water body. Khan's body was found about 150 metres away from the site.

12.title: The box office start has sent shockwaves: Girish on 'Laal...', 'Raksha...'
12.article_body: Girish Johar, who is a co-producer of Aishwarya Rai Bachchan-starrer 'Jazbaa', said the box office start of 'Laal Singh Chaddha' and 'Raksha Bandhan' has sent "shockwaves". "Imagine that Aamir Khan coming after four years and Akshay Kumar...combined are not even clocking ₹20 crore on a big holiday release," added Girish. "No one wants to watch [a] bad film," he stated.

13.title: UP CM announces ₹4 lakh ex-gratia for families of those killed in Banda boat mishap
13.article_body: Uttar Pradesh Chief Minister Yogi Adityanath on Friday announced ex-gratia of ₹4 lakh each for families of people who died in boat mishap in Banda. The Chief Minister has also given instructions for immediate help and relief to the victims and proper treatment to those injured in the accident. The boat capsized due to strong winds, police had earlier said.

14.title: 2,000 live cartridges recovered in Delhi ahead of Independence Day; 6 arrested
14.article_body: As many as 2,000 live cartridges have been recovered in Delhi ahead of Independence Day and six persons have been arrested, police said. The accused were arrested from the Anand Vihar area in the national capital with two bags of cartridges. Those arrested are being questioned about where the 2,000 live cartridges were to be supplied, police added.

15.title: Boulders fall on railway tracks on Mumbai-Pune line; trains delayed
15.article_body: A few trains were delayed after boulders and muck fell on the railway tracks between the Nagnath-Palasdhari section and the Lonavala-Karjat Ghat section on the Mumbai-Pune line around 12.50 am on Friday, railway officials said. The boulders, that fell on the Up-line which goes towards Mumbai, were removed by 8.15 am after which services were restored, officials added.

16.title: Light to moderate rainfall in Pune till August 15, no warnings: IMD
16.article_body: India Meteorological Department (IMD) predicted light to moderate rains in Pune and isolated heavy rains in ghat regions for Friday. From August 13 to August 15, light rains are very likely in Pune, it added. IMD released no warnings for Pune and ghat regions from Friday onwards. "The monsoon trough...oscillates around its normal position till August 16," an official said.

17.title: Shapoorji Pallonji to offload 1.25% stake in Sterling and Wilson
17.article_body: Shapoorji Pallonji And Company Private Limited has proposed to offload its 1.25% stake, which comprises up to 23,70,787 equity shares, in Sterling and Wilson Renewable Energy Limited (SWREL). The floor price of the offer shall be ₹270 per equity share of the company, SWREL said. The offer for sale (OFS) will take place on Friday for non-retail investors.

18.title: Dwayne Bravo creates history, becomes 1st bowler to take 600 wickets in T20 cricket
18.article_body: West Indian all-rounder Dwayne Bravo has created history by becoming the first bowler to take 600 wickets in T20 cricket. The 38-year-old reached the 600-wicket mark after picking up two wickets for Northern Superchargers against Oval Invincibles in The Hundred on Thursday. He reached 600 wickets in 516 T20 innings.

19.title: 3 schoolgirls kidnapped, raped in Delhi; 2 women among those arrested
19.article_body: Three schoolgirls were kidnapped and raped after being given beverages laced with sedatives in Delhi's Rohini, police said on Thursday. Four people, including two women, have been arrested in connection with this case, police added. Girls said that one of the accused took them to a house where they were kept hostage and raped.

20.title: 2 from B'desh arrested for using drone near Kolkata's Victoria Memorial
20.article_body: Two Bangladeshi nationals were arrested for allegedly using a drone near Kolkata's Victoria Memorial Hall on Wednesday, police said. The accused were reportedly taking pictures of the memorial and its surrounding areas without any permission. "Flying drones in and around the Victoria Memorial Hall is prohibited as it's a no-drone zone and...falls in the defence area," an official said.

21.title: SC sets August 28 as new deadline for Noida twin towers demolition
21.article_body: Supreme Court has given an additional time of one week for the demolition of Supertech's twin 40-storey towers in Uttar Pradesh's Noida. The demolition, which was scheduled for August 21, will now take place on August 28. SC has also granted a seven-day buffer, from August 29 to September 4, in case of any "technical glitches or weather-related problems".

22.title: Taliban cleric who supported female education killed by bomb hidden in artificial limb
22.article_body: A prominent Afghan cleric who supported the Taliban and was in favour of female education has been killed. Sheikh Rahimullah Haqqani was targeted by a man who detonated explosives hidden in an artificial plastic limb, Reuters said quoting Taliban sources. The Islamic State (IS) group claimed responsibility for the bombing saying it happened inside his office.

23.title: It's a sad loss: Mumbai chief selector on Arjun Tendulkar playing for Goa
23.article_body: Mumbai chief selector Salil Ankola has termed Sachin Tendulkar's son Arjun Tendulkar's decision to represent Goa as a "sad loss for Mumbai cricket". "He wasn't getting many opportunities in Mumbai because there were already a set of fast bowlers playing...I am sure Goa is going to gain a lot out of him," added Ankola. "Arjun works very hard," he stated.

24.title: Govt shares pics of man wiping metro floor after co-passenger drops food; praises him
24.article_body: The government has shared pictures of a man wiping the floor of a metro train. "Here's a citizen who walks the talk of #Swachhata. Pranjal Dubey showed the true meaning of #JanBhagidari by picking up the food spilled on the floor by a co-passenger & wiping the floor with his handkerchief," it tweeted.

25.title: My kiss in 'Darlings' took me by surprise, it's a sweet, delicate moment: Shefali
25.article_body: Actress Shefali Shah said that her kiss scene in 'Darlings' took her by surprise, adding that it was a sweet and delicate moment. "I thought, 'Hain, ye kya ho gaya (Wow, what just happened)," she said. "One of the shots we did...I ran to kiss him and [my] bag hit my face and we both kissed the bag," Shefali added.

26.title: Woman asks Delhi HC to stop 48-yr-old Noida man's trip to Europe for euthanasia
26.article_body: A Bengaluru-based woman has moved Delhi High Court, asking it to stop her 48-year-old Noida-based friend with Chronic Fatigue Syndrome from travelling to Europe allegedly to undergo euthanasia. The plea stated that he's bed bound and just able to walk a few steps. The woman pleaded that his parents would suffer "irreparable loss" and "hardship" if his trip isn't halted.

27.title: Avinash used to be so lazy, he would eat vada pav daily, jokes brother
27.article_body: Talking about Avinash Sable, who is the first Indian athlete to win a medal in 3,000m steeplechase event at CWG, having bagged silver at CWG 2022, his brother Yogesh jokingly said Avinash used to be "very lazy". Yogesh added that Avinash would eat vada pav daily after college. "He had put on so much [weight]," stated their father Mukund.

28.title: Odisha govt to distribute 30 lakh National Flags for free
28.article_body: The Odisha government will distribute 30 lakh National Flags for free ahead of Independence Day. "There is great enthusiasm among the people of the country to mark the occasion, extensive preparations are being made for this at the government and private levels," the official statement read. The 'Har Ghar Tiranga' campaign will be held from August 13 to 15.

29.title: Aryan Khan's debut web show to be satire on film industry: Report
29.article_body: Shah Rukh Khan's son Aryan Khan is working on his debut web show which will be a satire on the film industry, reported PeepingMoon. As per the report, Aryan will serve as the showrunner but might not direct it. He is reportedly working with a team of writers at Red Chillies Entertainment and will take it on floors in 2023.

30.title: Russian reporter who called Putin a 'killer' put under house arrest
30.article_body: A Russian court on Thursday placed former state TV journalist Marina Ovsyannikova under house arrest for nearly two months, pending an investigation on charges of spreading false information about Russia's armed forces. Marina Ovsyannikova was charged over a street protest last month when she held up a banner calling Russian President Vladimir Putin a "killer" and his soldiers "fascists".

31.title: Valuations of US startups seeking early-stage funding contract
31.article_body: US startups seeking early-stage funding have seen a decline in valuations in Q2 as investors become more cautious. Investors are urging founders to make more concessions, as last year's easy fiscal policies and stimulus measures that led to an investment frenzy are fading away. Median pre-money valuation for early-stage funding rounds was down 16% from Q1, as per a report.

32.title: French Air Force contingent makes stopover at IAF's Sulur base
32.article_body: As part of a mega military operation, a French Air and Space Force contingent, which included three Rafale jets, made a stopover at the Indian Air Force's Sulur station in Tamil Nadu. A French readout said that the cooperation with the IAF demonstrated a high level of mutual trust and interoperability between the two sides.

33.title: Man tries to drown woman in public fountain in Spain; pics show 2 men saving her
33.article_body: A woman was rescued by two bystanders after a man appeared to be forcing her head down into a public fountain in broad daylight in Spain's Valencia. Pictures and video of the incident have surfaced online, showing two men jumping inside the fountain before punching and hitting the man to save the woman.

34.title: Johnson & Johnson to stop selling talc-based baby powder after 38,000 cancer lawsuits
34.article_body: Johnson & Johnson has announced that it will stop making and selling its talc-based baby powder around the world from next year. The company will transition to an all cornstarch-based baby powder portfolio, which is already sold worldwide. Johnson & Johnson faces 38,000 lawsuits from consumers and their survivors claiming its talc products caused cancer due to contamination with asbestos.

35.title: There are concerns over Shaheen's fitness, hope he'll play Asia Cup: Babar
35.article_body: Pakistan captain Babar Azam said there are "concerns" over pacer Shaheen Shah Afridi's fitness, adding that he hopes Shaheen will play in the Asia Cup 2022. "We are trying to ensure he can get ready as soon as possible," added Babar. Team India pacers Jasprit Bumrah and Harshal Patel are not available for the tournament due to injuries.

36.title: Massive fire breaks out at hotel near Gujarat's Jamnagar, 27 rescued
36.article_body: A massive fire broke out at a five-storey hotel near Gujarat's Jamnagar on Thursday and 27 people were rescued, police said. "The fire started around 7.30 pm...27 guests were staying in 18 of the total 36 rooms. They were all rescued...Hotel staff too is safe," police added. The fire was brought under control around 10.30 pm, police stated.

37.title: Delhi AQI to be 'satisfactory', city to witness 'moderate temperature'
37.article_body: System of Air Quality and Weather Forecasting and Research on Thursday said that Delhi will witness "moderate temperature" in coming days. "For...next 3 days...AQI is likely to be within 'satisfactory' or 'lower end of moderate' due to expected light rain/drizzle spells. Moderate temperature (~ 34-35 deg C) and mixing layer height (~ 2.0) [to] maintain moderate ventilation," the agency said.

38.title: Bengaluru CCB arrests 2 serial extortioners, seizes ₹78 lakh-phones
38.article_body: The Central Crime Branch (CCB) of the Bengaluru City Police has arrested two serial extortioners who were wanted in several cases of mobile phone thefts, the police tweeted on Thursday. The police said that 512 smartphones worth ₹78 lakh have also been seized. The accused used to sell the extorted mobile phones in Mumbai, Hyderabad and Delhi, the police added.

39.title: 4 female, 3 male students suspended over 'inappropriate act' in Assam classroom
39.article_body: A college in Assam has suspended seven students after a video showing them engaging in an "inappropriate act" in a classroom surfaced on social media. Principal of the college said, "The students did this turpitude act in tiffin hours when no teachers were present." Four of the seven students are female, and three are male.

40.title: Dabur India Chairman Amit Burman resigns
40.article_body: Dabur India on Friday announced that the board has accepted Chairman Amit Burman's resignation with effect from August 10, 2022. Burman will continue to serve as the Non-Executive Director for the company. When Dabur Foods forayed into the processed food industry in 1999, Burman took over as the CEO. In 2019, he took charge as the Chairman of Dabur India.

41.title: Search operation resumes for 17 missing people as boat capsizes in UP
41.article_body: Teams of the National Disaster Response Force (NDRF) and the State Disaster Response Force (SDRF) resumed search operation this morning for 17 missing people after their boat capsized in the Yamuna river in UP's Banda district. The boat was carrying 30 to 40 people and was going from Fatehpur to Marka village. Three bodies have been recovered till now.

42.title: Punjab Assembly Speaker's security staff assault truck driver; he apologises
42.article_body: Punjab Assembly Speaker Kultar Singh Sandhwan's security personnel allegedly brutally thrashed a truck driver after the truck rammed into Sandhwan's car on the Amritsar-Jalandhar bypass road on Thursday. A purported video of the incident has surfaced online. Sandhwan, who escaped unhurt, later said that his security staff had argued with the truck driver and apologised for it.

43.title: Akshay's 'Raksha Bandhan' opens at ₹7.5 cr, his worst opening of 2022
43.article_body: Actor Akshay Kumar's third film of 2022 'Raksha Bandhan' collected ₹7.5 crore on its opening day making it his worst opening of the year. His earlier films 'Bachchhan Paandey' and 'Samrat Prithviraj' had earned ₹13.2 crore and ₹10.7 crore on their opening days, respectively. 'Raksha Bandhan' clashed with Aamir Khan-starrer 'Laal Singh Chaddha' which collected ₹10.75 crore at its opening.

44.title: BMTC to offer free bus rides on all routes on Independence Day
44.article_body: Bengaluru Metropolitan Transport Corporation (BMTC), in order to mark its 25 years, has decided to give free bus services on all routes on Independence Day. The service will cover all ordinary, AC and special Volvo buses run by BMTC. Further, on August 16, the corporation will present medals to drivers who haven't been involved in any accidents during their service.

45.title: A must-watch, joyful ride: Rajkummar Rao on 'Laal Singh Chaddha'
45.article_body: Actor Rajkummar Rao on Thursday took to Instagram Stories to appreciate Aamir Khan and Kareena Kapoor-starrer 'Laal Singh Chaddha'. The actor wrote, "'Laal Singh Chaddha' is a [must-watch]. Such a beautiful film. What a joyful emotional ride...And the most wonderful surprise cameo ever." The Advait Chandan directorial features a special appearance by actor Shah Rukh Khan.

46.title: Car falls into river under bridge in Pune; 5 of family rescued
46.article_body: The fire brigade rescued five members of a family, including two children, after their car fell into the river under Pune's SM Joshi Bridge on Friday. The firemen rescued the family using ropes, life jackets and other equipment. The car was washed away by the river's current, which had apparently strengthened after water was released from a dam.

47.title: Elon Musk responds after Ford CEO mocks him over Tesla's delayed EV truck
47.article_body: Tesla CEO Elon Musk has responded after Ford CEO Jim Farley mocked the electric car company over its delayed release of Cybertruck and called Ford's F-150 Lightning the "leader of all EV pickup trucks" in the United States. "Take that, Elon Musk," Farley further said during an event. Responding to this, Musk said, "Thanks, but I already have one."

48.title: UP govt to induct 100 youths under CM fellowship programme for governance
48.article_body: The Uttar Pradesh government is planning to recruit about 100 youths under its Chief Minister fellowship programme for governance. The government has invited applications to appoint one research scholar for each of the 100 backward blocks of the state to work on policymaking, research and development. A budget of ₹5.58 crore has been allotted for the programme in first year.

49.title: 31 injured after 2 rollercoaster trains collide at Legoland in Germany
49.article_body: At least 31 people were injured after two rollercoaster trains collided at Legoland's theme park in Germany on Thursday. Three helicopters were deployed to the scene. People reportedly had to be carried down from a height of at least 16 feet. Last week, a 57-year-old woman died after falling from a moving rollercoaster in an amusement park in Germany's Klotten.

50.title: Woman beaten, clothes forcibly removed in Madhya Pradesh; 4 arrested
50.article_body: Police arrested four persons after a woman was beaten and her clothes were forcibly removed in Madhya Pradesh's Jhabua. This comes after she returned to her husband whom she had left eight months ago and went to live with her partner. The incident took place when the woman's partner came to her village to take her back with him.

51.title: Aditya Birla Health Insurance to get ₹665 cr investment from ADIA
51.article_body: The boards of Aditya Birla Capital and Aditya Birla Health Insurance have approved a proposal to infuse ₹665 crore capital into the health insurer from an Abu Dhabi Investment Authority (ADIA) subsidiary. ADIA will hold 9.99% stake in Aditya Birla Health Insurance, while Aditya Birla Capital and South Africa-based Momentum Metropolitan Holdings will own a 45.91% and 44.10% stake, respectively.

52.title: Barcelona's Aubameyang picks Lionel Messi over Cristiano Ronaldo
52.article_body: Barcelona striker Pierre-Emerick Aubameyang picked Lionel Messi over Manchester United's Cristiano Ronaldo when asked to choose between the two during an interview. Aubameyang further went on to select arch-rivals Real Madrid over Premier League club Tottenham Hotspur. Responding to a query over the player he will pick between Rafael Nadal and Roger Federer, Aubameyang named Nadal.

53.title: Vigilance agency raids 26 premises of former TN CM Palaniswami's aide
53.article_body: The Directorate of Vigilance and Anti-Corruption conducted raids at 26 premises of former AIADMK MLA, KPP Baskar, and his family in connection with a disproportionate assets case. Baskar is a close aide of former Tamil Nadu CM and AIADMK's interim General Secretary Edappadi Palaniswami. The agency claimed that Baskar's assets were disproportionate to that of his income by ₹4.72 crore.

54.title: Actor Alec Baldwin's wife responds to rumours that her baby bump is fake
54.article_body: Actor Alec Baldwin's wife Hilaria has responded to rumours that her baby bump is fake. "My friends made a good point about my belly. It kind of looks like a fake...like I ate a ball...I guess the psycho conspiracy theorists online with way too much time on their hands have somewhat of a point here," she wrote on Instagram.

55.title: Samsung's billionaire heir jailed for bribery gets presidential pardon in S Korea
55.article_body: Samsung's billionaire heir Lee Jae-yong, who was sentenced to jail last year over bribery and embezzlement, received a presidential pardon in South Korea on Friday. The country's minister Han Dong-hoon said Lee Jae-yong will be "reinstated" to give him a chance to "contribute to overcoming the economic crisis". He was released on parole in August last year.

56.title: Armed man tries to enter FBI office in Ohio, shot dead in standoff
56.article_body: An armed man was killed after he tried to "breach" an FBI building in Cincinnati, Ohio, on Thursday, officials said. The man had fled the scene after the attempted breach and was shot dead following a car chase, gun battle and a standoff in a rural area, they added. Authorities are probing if he'd ties to the far-right extremist groups.

57.title: Driver carrying cargo to UP finds over 15 feet long python under truck seat
57.article_body: A driver who was carrying cargo from Madhya Pradesh to Uttar Pradesh in his truck found a 15 feet long python curled up under his seat, reports said. The driver felt some movement under his seat when he stopped for a meal. He alerted people around him and a forest team was called in to get the reptile out.

58.title: India reports 16,561 new COVID-19 cases, active cases stand at 1,23,535
58.article_body: India has reported 16,561 COVID-19 cases in the last 24 hours, according to the Ministry of Health and Family Welfare. This comes a day after the country saw 16,299 COVID-19 cases. Active cases in India stand at 1,23,535, while the death toll has risen to 5,26,928, according to the latest data.

59.title: Aamir's 'Laal Singh Chaddha' opens at ₹10.75 cr, his lowest in 13 years
59.article_body: Aamir Khan-starrer 'Laal Singh Chaddha' collected ₹10.75 crore on its opening day, as per Box Office India. This is the actor's lowest opening in the last 13 years. His 2018 film 'Thugs of Hindostan' had opened at ₹52 crore. 'Laal Singh Chaddha' recorded the third biggest opening for a Hindi film in 2022 after 'Bhool Bhulaiyaa 2' and 'Bachchhan Paandey'.

60.title: Wish 'Samrat Prithviraj' worked, but we have to accept failures: Sonu Sood
60.article_body: Speaking about the box office failure of 'Samrat Prithviraj', actor Sonu Sood said that he wishes the film had done well, adding that it is one of the special films of his career. "You have to accept your failures and learn from them and next time you can be better, you can deliver better," the actor added.

61.title: 20-year-old woman afraid of failing CA examination kills self in Nagpur
61.article_body: A 20-year-old woman, who was preparing for Chartered Accountancy (CA) examination, allegedly died by suicide, fearing failure. The incident took place in wee hours of Wednesday, an official said. The official further said that the woman had, before taking the step, messaged her mother and other family members, stating that she was scared of failing the exam.

62.title: Shah Rukh Khan to play Vanar Astra in 'Brahmāstra', pics leaked
62.article_body: Pictures and videos have surfaced on social media showing actor Shah Rukh Khan as Vanar Astra in Ayan Mukerji's upcoming film 'Brahmāstra'. The film, which is part one of a trilogy, features Ranbir Kapoor, Alia Bhatt, Amitabh Bachchan and Mouni Roy. Shah Rukh recently made cameo appearances in Aamir Khan's 'Laal Singh Chaddha' and R Madhavan's 'Rocketry: The Nambi Effect'.

63.title: Bring back Congress for completion of projects in Raj: Gehlot urges people
63.article_body: Rajasthan CM Ashok Gehlot on Thursday urged people to vote for Congress in the next state Assembly polls, saying his government's ouster will stall ongoing development projects. Gehlot said the Barmer refinery project was delayed as Congress was ousted from power in 2014. "Only if our government is repeated, we would be able to complete ongoing projects," Gehlot added.

64.title: Axar has stronger claim than Jadeja as pure bowler: Manjrekar on T20 WC
64.article_body: Ex-India batter Sanjay Manjrekar said Axar Patel and Ravichandran Ashwin have a "stronger" claim than Ravindra Jadeja, considering the role of a pure bowler, in India's squad for T20 World Cup 2022. "Jadeja isn't somebody you can go to in...first six overs whereas you can with Axar," added Manjrekar. "Jadeja...knows there is some serious competition coming in," he stated.

65.title: Paytm CEO Vijay Shekhar's reappointment opposed by advisory firm
65.article_body: The Institutional Investor Advisory Services India (IiAS) has advised shareholders to vote against the reappointment of Vijay Shekhar Sharma as the Chief Executive Officer (CEO) of Paytm parent One97 Communications. It has also opposed his remuneration. The advisory firm said it believes "the board must consider professionalising the management” as Sharma's "commitments" haven't played out.

66.title: Sensex falls 68 points, Nifty at 17,639 in opening trade
66.article_body: The benchmark indices opened in red on Friday with Sensex and Nifty falling 68.30 points and 19.20 points, respectively. The Sensex opened at 59,264.30 points and Nifty at 17,639.80. ONGC, IndusInd Bank, Titan Company, ICICI Bank and Hindalco were among the major Nifty gainers, while Apollo Hospitals, Tata Motors, Tech Mahindra, Infosys and Wipro slipped.

67.title: Migrant labourer from Bihar shot dead by terrorists in J&K's Bandipora
67.article_body: A migrant labourer from Bihar's Madhepura, identified as Mohd Amrez, was shot dead by terrorists on Thursday at Soadnara Sumbal in Jammu and Kashmir's Bandipora. "During the intervening night, terrorists fired upon Mohd Amrez...He was shifted to a hospital...where he succumbed," police said. "We thought he went to toilet...saw him lying in a pool of blood," the deceased's brother said.

68.title: Trump's Florida home raided by FBI in search of nuclear documents: Report
68.article_body: The FBI agents were looking for documents relating to nuclear weapons when they raided former US President Donald Trump's home in Florida this week, The Washington Post has reported. However, it was unclear if such documents were recovered at Trump's Mar-a-Lago resort. On Thursday, the Justice Department lawyers filed a motion seeking to unseal the search warrant in the case.

69.title: It was a dummy plane: Influencer Bobby Kataria after smoking video goes viral
69.article_body: After a video of Bobby Kataria smoking inside a plane went viral on social media, the influencer said that the video was shot in a dummy plane that was a part of his shooting. "How can a lighter make its way into an airplane?" he said. Meanwhile, SpiceJet said the video was shot on January 20, 2022.

70.title: Within 4 mins, robbers loot ₹13 lakh from bank in Punjab; probe on
70.article_body: A probe has been initiated after five armed robbers stole ₹13 lakh from a branch of the Punjab National Bank in a village in Punjab's Ludhiana before escaping within four minutes on Thursday. The bank had no security guard. The accused also took bank employees' phones so that they couldn't inform the police, which the former threw away before escaping.

71.title: Yen falls the most against US dollar as markets rethink Fed move
71.article_body: With markets expecting the US Federal Reserve to do much more to contain inflation, the Japanese yen fell the most against the US dollar on Friday. On Thursday, the dollar index rose 0.1% to 105.210, while the yen fell 0.12% to 133.19 per dollar. The sterling traded down 0.23% at $1.21 and the euro fell to $1.03 against the dollar.

72.title: May not be qualified enough: Pankaja Munde on not being in Maha cabinet
72.article_body: Bharatiya Janata Party leader Pankaja Munde said that she "may not be qualified enough" to be inducted into the Maharashtra cabinet. "Whoever is eligible according to them will be inducted into the cabinet. I have no stand about it. I try to do my politics by maintaining my pride," Munde added after expansion of the cabinet.

73.title: Heavy to very heavy rainfall warning in several states; list released
73.article_body: IMD has predicted isolated very heavy rainfall in Madhya Pradesh, Maharashtra, Chhattisgarh and Odisha between August 13 and 15. Heavy rainfall is likely over West Bengal, Jharkhand, Arunachal Pradesh, Assam, Meghalaya, Nagaland, Manipur, Mizoram, Tripura between August 12 and 15. Isolated heavy falls are also likely over Karnataka, J&K, Himachal Pradesh, coastal Andhra Pradesh and Uttarakhand.

74.title: It is my best film, has made me 'cry' so much: Akshay on 'Raksha...'
74.article_body: Actor Akshay Kumar said 'Raksha Bandhan' is the "best" film of his career, adding that the movie has made him "cry so much". "I'm not someone who cries watching films," added Akshay. The film's director Aanand L Rai stated he had to unlearn a lot of things to make the film. "I had to lose all my smartness," added Aanand.

75.title: Doubting wife's character, auto driver kills her using spade in Rajasthan
75.article_body: Doubting his wife's character, a 30-year-old autorickshaw driver killed his 25-year-old wife using a spade in Rajasthan. The accused was arrested and confessed to his crime. Police said the relatives of the woman have registered a case of murder against 11 people as they suspect involvement of others in the murder. A case has been registered against all.

76.title: I don't have time for people venting: Kareena on not using Twitter
76.article_body: Speaking about not being a Twitter user, actress Kareena Kapoor stated that she feels like the social media platform is for people who "just want to keep venting". She further said that celebrities are trolled on Twitter every other day amid cancel culture. "That's why I'm not on Twitter...I don't have time for that," the actress stated.

77.title: CISF holds Tiranga bike rally in Hyderabad
77.article_body: Ahead of Independence Day, Central Industrial Security Force (CISF) on Thursday held a Tiranga bike rally in Hyderabad. National Flags were also distributed among commuters to support the 'Har Ghar Tiranga' campaign. "All CISF personnel inclusive of all ranks carried out a bike rally holding Tricolours in their hands in city side area of Hyderabad airport," an official statement said.

78.title: US Justice Dept seeks to unseal search warrant of Trump’s home
78.article_body: The US Justice Department is asking a court to unseal the warrant that let FBI agents search ex-President Donald Trump's Florida home. If granted, the documents would be available to the public. Monday's FBI search of Trump's Mar-a-Lago property is believed to be connected to an investigation into whether he removed classified records and sensitive material from the White House.

79.title: 6 killed after Congress MLA's son-in-law rams SUV into bike, rickshaw in Gujarat
79.article_body: At least six persons, including three women, died in an accident that took place between a car, bike and an auto-rickshaw on Thursday at around 7 pm in Gujarat's Anand, police said. Khetan Padhiyar, the son-in-law of Congress MLA Punambhai Madhabhai Parmar from Sojitra, allegedly rammed his SUV into the bike and auto-rickshaw. Khetan has been arrested, police added.

80.title: 6-yr-old girl kidnapped from Pune bus depot, rescued within 12 hrs
80.article_body: Pune police have rescued a six-year-old girl who was kidnapped from the Swargate bus depot within 12 hours. Two women were arrested for allegedly abducting the girl due to an ongoing financial dispute between their family and the girl's family, a senior police inspector said. "Our team rescued the girl from Solapur on Wednesday evening," the senior police inspector added.

81.title: Man sentenced to 20 yrs in jail for sexually assaulting minor in Hyd
81.article_body: A Hyderabad court on Thursday sentenced a man to 20 years of imprisonment for sexually assaulting an eight-year-old girl in 2015. According to reports, the victim's parents worked at a college and lived on campus with their two children. On August 26, when the girl's parents left the room, the accused reportedly took her to nearby bushes and assaulted her.

82.title: Went to Sonam's bully, felt it'd be like SRK in Josh; got socked in eye: Arjun
82.article_body: Actor Arjun Kapoor said he got "black eye" after he went to actress Sonam Kapoor's bully in school. Arjun said he asked the bully how can he talk to Sonam in a certain way, adding that he imagined it would be like Shah Rukh Khan in 'Josh' where two gangs fight, but he just got "socked in the eye".

83.title: Don't reveal our military tactics against Russia: Zelenskyy to officials
83.article_body: Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskyy has told officials to stop talking to journalists about the country's military tactics against Russia, saying such remarks are "frankly irresponsible". "War is definitely not the time for vanity and loud statements. The fewer details you divulge about our defence plans, the better it will be for the implementation of those defence plans," Zelenskyy said.

84.title: Pune's weekly COVID positivity rate reaches 12.14%; 2nd highest in Maha
84.article_body: Pune's weekly COVID-19 positivity rate has reached 12.14%, the second highest in Maharashtra, officials said. "While districts like Pune and Mumbai reported a surge in COVID-19 cases, other districts did not. Now the cases in these districts see a decline, other districts are reporting a surge," an official said. Gondia district reported the highest weekly COVID-19 positivity rate at 12.37%.

85.title: 2 of family die, 2 injured as recently purchased AC explodes in Mumbai
85.article_body: Two members of a family were killed while two others were critically injured after an AC that was recently purchased by the family exploded in Mumbai. The blast, reports said, caused a level one fire. A neighbour said that the fire broke out while the family was sleeping. Laxmi Rathod and her daughter Madhu were killed in the incident.

86.title: Cook dies of snake bite at Hyderabad's Osmania University campus
86.article_body: A 45-yr-old cook died due to snake bite at Hyderabad's Osmania University campus on Wednesday night. The incident occurred when the woman, identified as Kavita, was working in the kitchen at Manjeera hostel. Kavita was rushed to Gandhi Hospital where she died during treatment, police said. Following the incident, students and employees demanded adequate steps against the problem.

87.title: Seats are filling fast for IIM Indore’s IPBA program : UNext Jigsaw
87.article_body: IIM Indore and UNext Jigsaw announced that very few seats remain for 14th batch of their online Integrated program in Business Analytics (IPBA) which covers subjects with 10+ graded assignments, industry-relevant case studies and capstone project. Moreover, 83% alums boosted their career with 48% average salary hike, it revealed. With IIM alum status, get access to its campus and library.

88.title: Google asks Apple to fix texting, says 'green bubbles make chats difficult to read'
88.article_body: Google has launched a campaign to pressure Apple into adopting RCS, a next-generation standard for text messaging. Google has asked Apple to "fix texting" between iPhone and Android devices, citing blurry videos, missing read receipts, and no texting over Wi-Fi. It has criticised the green-coloured bubbles for chats on iPhones with Android devices, saying it makes texts difficult to read.

89.title: I rejected Saif's marriage proposal twice before agreeing: Kareena
89.article_body: Actress Kareena Kapoor said she rejected husband and actor Saif Ali Khan's marriage proposal twice before agreeing. "He told me that in Greece and...in Ladakh...At that time, I was like, 'I don't know because I don't know you'...It was more like an 'I want to know you better'," added Kareena. "What's important is that finally I said yes," she stated.

90.title: B'luru AC bus fleet more than halved due to WFH, rising fuel costs
90.article_body: Bengaluru Metropolitan Transport Corporation (BMTC) has reduced its AC bus fleet to 373 from 834 amid a lack of demand as many IT professionals are choosing to work from home (WFH), a BMTC official said. The official added that IT professionals use 90% of these buses. Rising fuel costs and operational charges are also a factor, another BMTC official stated.

91.title: Delhi LG orders FIR against 11 ex-DDA officials in 9-yr-old corruption case
91.article_body: Delhi Lieutenant Governor (LG) VK Saxena has ordered the registration of FIRs against 11 former Delhi Development Authority (DDA) officials in a 2013 corruption case. The case pertains to the upgradation and beautification of Kingsway Camp's Coronation Park, the tender cost of which was ₹14.24 crore but additional work amounting to ₹114.83 crore was also carried out without any sanctions.

92.title: Water seen dripping on seats inside SpiceJet flight from Mumbai; video surfaces
92.article_body: A video showing water dripping on seats inside Mumbai-Jabalpur SpiceJet flight is being widely circulated online. Passengers said they were given different seats after complaining about water leakage, however, one of them still had water dripping in front of his seat. The passenger said he would complain about the matter to the Civil Aviation Ministry.

93.title: 3 men fire at Mumbai's Gazebo Market, threaten to kill stall vendors
93.article_body: Three men on a bike fired three rounds at the Gazebo Market on Linking Road in Mumbai's Bandra West. The incident took place on Thursday night. Reports said that the bikers also threatened to kill all those who had put up stalls in the area. Police reportedly said they suspect that people from the land mafia might be behind firing.

94.title: Asia's richest man Adani gets Z category security after intel flags threat: Report
94.article_body: Asia's richest man and Adani Group's 60-year-old Chairman Gautam Adani has been given Z category security cover from the central government, a report said. The decision is said to have been taken on the basis of a threat perception report by the Intelligence Bureau. Adani, who has a fortune of $126 billion, will reportedly bear the expenses for the security.

95.title: Car thief caught hiding inside giant 'breathing' teddy bear in UK; pics go viral
95.article_body: A man in the United Kingdom who was wanted for car theft was sent to jail on Friday after police found him hiding inside a giant teddy bear. Joshua Dobson, 18, had been wanted by the police since May. "Our officers noticed a large bear breathing in the address," the Greater Manchester Police wrote in a post on Facebook.

96.title: Urvashi responds after Pant says 'Leave me alone, sister'; calls him 'cougar hunter'
96.article_body: After cricketer Rishabh Pant seemingly responded to actress Urvashi Rautela's recent viral interview wherein she talked about a person named 'RP', Urvashi Rautela reacted via an Instagram post. "Chotu bhaiyaa should play bat ball," she wrote while adding #cougarhunter. Pant had written 'Leave me alone, sister' while seemingly responding to Urvashi's remark that 'RP' wanted to meet her in Delhi.

97.title: Could've finished Darlings scene early but Alia, Shefali kept laughing: Jasmeet
97.article_body: 'Darlings' director Jasmeet K Reen said that the team could have finished filming a scene three-four hours earlier but actresses Shefali Shah and Alia Bhatt kept laughing. "They would say half line and they would just keep laughing...They have that kind of energy on set...They're so into it, and positive and fun...that sometimes they are just cracking up," Jasmeet said.

98.title: Man claims to be James Bond from UK, cheats Mumbai woman of ₹5.07 lakh
98.article_body: A 27-year-old woman from Mumbai was cheated of ₹5.07 lakh by cyber frauds, who posed as a businessman from the UK and identified himself as 'James Bond'. Police said that the accused sent a parcel full of expensive gifts to India, following which they posed as government officials and made the victim deposit ₹5.07 lakh in various accounts.

99.title: 25-yr-old Bihar woman police constable found dead in Pune hotel room
99.article_body: A 25-year-old woman police constable from Bihar, who was in Pune as part of an investigation, was found dead in a hotel room on Thursday afternoon. A senior police officer said that while the preliminary probe points to suicide, senior officials from Pimpri Chinchwad and Muzaffarpur were coordinating with each other to investigate the cause of the death.

100.title: Maternal uncle allegedly rapes 16-year-old girl in Gurugram
100.article_body: A 16-year-old girl was allegedly raped by her maternal uncle in Gurugram, police said on Thursday. According to the girl's complaint, her uncle called her to his home in Bhondsi area, where he lives with his wife and son, to learn sewing on July 10. He raped the girl on July 28 and August 7, police said citing the complaint.

101.title: Inter-state human trafficking racket busted in Navi Mumbai; 17 rescued
101.article_body: Mumbai Police recently busted an inter-state human trafficking racket running in four Navi Mumbai flats and rescued 17 women hailing from West Bengal, Uttar Pradesh and Madhya Pradesh who were forced into prostitution. Police has arrested nine people and are looking for two main accused. The incident came to light after a 24-year-old woman managed to flee from the flat.

102.title: 27-yr-old Mumbai woman tries buying whiskey online, loses ₹5.35 lakh
102.article_body: A 27-year-old woman from Mumbai lost ₹5.35 lakh to frauds, who posed as wine shop executives and cheated her on the pretext of delivering a bottle of whiskey to her house. The accused also convinced the woman to increase her debit card limit that helped them withdraw ₹5.35 lakh from her account till Wednesday noon, a police official said.

103.title: Court acquits Mumbai man in rash driving case due to poor road condition
103.article_body: A 61-year-old man in Mumbai was acquitted in a rash driving case after the court noted that it appears it wasn't the accused's fault as the road at the accident site was dug up. The court noted that it's not sufficient to prove the accident took place by accused's vehicle. The victim had suffered a broken leg and ankle.

104.title: Pet pitbull dog attacks, seriously injures 35-yr-old house help in Gurugram
104.article_body: A pet pitbull dog allegedly attacked and seriously injured a 35-year-old house help who was on her way to work in Gurugram's Civil Lines area on Thursday morning. A police officer, requesting anonymity, said preliminary probe has found that the dog attacked her from behind and bit into her neck. The dog let her go after intervention from a passerby.

105.title: Australia cricketers donate tour prize money to children, families in crisis-hit SL
105.article_body: Australian men's cricket team players donated their prize money from the recent all-format tour of Sri Lanka to support children and families impacted by Sri Lanka's economic crisis. In all, the team donated AU$45,000 to UNICEF Australia's Sri Lanka appeal. "It was very clear to us how much day-to-day life for Sri Lankans is being impacted," Pat Cummins said.

106.title: Satellite photographs indicate serious damage to Crimea air base
106.article_body: Commercially available satellite photographs taken before and after purported explosions in Crimea's Saki air base earlier this week show heavy damage sustained by the station. Earlier, Russia, which controls Crimea, denied any attack in the peninsula and rubbished reports of any damage to its aircraft. Ukraine has claimed nine Russian aircraft were destroyed in Crimea.

107.title: Mohali Police arrest 2 for extorting businessmen in the district
107.article_body: Mohali Police have arrested two people who were involved in extorting businessmen in the district. The accused were members of a gang and were already wanted for firing outside a nightclub in March. According to Mohali Senior Superintendent of Police (SSP) Vivek Sheel Soni, the arrested would scare businessmen by firing outside their homes or offices to get money extorted.

108.title: Sitabuldi Fort to open as part of Independence Day celebrations
108.article_body: The Indian Army will open the Sitabuldi Fort as part of the 'Azadi ka Amrit Mahotsav' to commemorate 75 years of India's independence. A symbol of military heritage, the fort is controlled by the Indian Army. It is only opened to the general public on specific days and this year, as an exception, will be open for two days.

109.title: British Instagrammer asked to leave Sri Lanka after she backed protesters
109.article_body: A British woman Instagrammer who was in Sri Lanka has been asked by authorities to leave the country before August 15 for participating in anti-government protests. Officials seized Kayleigh Fraser's passport to check if she had violated any of the visa conditions while staying in the crisis-hit country. Fraser had posted images and videos of the recent 'GotaGoHome' protest campaign.

110.title: BJP will be uprooted in 2024, will lose 40 LS seats in 3 states: JD(U)
110.article_body: Janata Dal (United) National President Lalan Singh on Thursday stated that BJP will be uprooted from power at the Centre in 2024. He added that BJP will lose 40 Lok Sabha seats out of its 2019 winning tally in three states — Bihar, Jharkhand and West Bengal. Singh made the remarks after meeting RJD chief Lalu Prasad Yadav.

111.title: Nykaa's CEO of private label division Reena Chhabra quits
111.article_body: In a regulatory filing, Nykaa said that the Chief Executive Officer (CEO) of its private label division FSN Brands, Reena Chhabra, has resigned, with effect from August 16. Earlier, she worked with cosmetic brand Colorbar as their COO and joined Nykaa in 2016. According to the draft red herring prospectus, she was paid a total of ₹3.06 crore in FY21.

112.title: BankBazaar.com to raise $100 mn in 3 years: CEO Adhil Shetty
112.article_body: BankBazaar.com is looking to raise $100 million in the next three years to aid the company's accelerating business practices, Founder and CEO Adhil Shetty said. The company expects to grow 80-90% in FY23, he added. Shetty said that the fintech firm achieved breakeven on a month-on-month basis in March 2022, and that they are currently not looking for immediate capital.

113.title: Pant honoured by Uttarakhand CM, months after being appointed state brand ambassador
113.article_body: Cricketer Rishabh Pant was on Thursday honoured by Uttarakhand Chief Minister Pushkar Singh Dhami in a programme organised at Uttarakhand Sadan in New Delhi, months after being appointed as the brand ambassador of the state. "It's no doubt a great feeling and also a huge responsibility," Pant wrote while sharing a picture on Instagram. Pant was born in Uttarakhand's Haridwar.

114.title: People chant 'chor-chor' as TMC leader Mondal is produced before court
114.article_body: Unidentified people chanted "chor-chor" (thief-thief) outside a CBI court in West Bengal's Asansol when Trinamool Congress (TMC) Birbhum district president Anubrata Mondal arrived there for a hearing on Thursday. People also showed black flags and shoes at his arrival. Mondal was arrested on Thursday in a cattle smuggling scam case. The CBI court has sent him to a 10-day custody.

115.title: Indian fintech startups to have $1 trillion assets by 2030: Report
115.article_body: Indian financial technology startups will have $1 trillion assets under management (AUM) and $200 billion revenue by 2030, a report by venture capital firm Chiratae Ventures and EY India said. The report added that fintechs' AUM in 2021 was around $100 billion and revenue around $20 billion. The digital lending market is expected to grow to $515 billion by 2030.

116.title: Tripura receives ₹50 cr to upgrade sports infrastructure in state
116.article_body: Tripura Sports Minister Sushanta Chowdhury announced that the state and central governments have sanctioned ₹50 crore to upgrade sports infrastructure in the state. "We want to develop sports infrastructure to ensure more good players come up. Also, sports will ensure youths don't take the path of drugs," he said. The government also decided to induct 100 new junior physical instructors.

117.title: Latvian Parliament declares Russia a 'state sponsor of terrorism'
117.article_body: The Latvian Parliament has declared Russia a “state sponsor of terrorism” for allegedly attacking civilians in its invasion of Ukraine. A strongly worded statement adopted by lawmakers in Riga said Moscow was using “suffering and intimidation as tools in its attempts to demoralise the Ukrainian people". In the 100-seat assembly, 67 lawmakers voted in favour of adopting the statement.

118.title: His condition has neither improved nor worsened: Raju Srivastava's daughter
118.article_body: Comedian Raju Srivastava continues to remain in the Intensive Care Unit of AIIMS after suffering from a heart attack. His daughter Antara, while sharing an update about his health, told Times of India, "His condition has neither improved nor worsened. The entire medical team is doing their best." "We are praying and hoping he will be fine soon," she added.

119.title: Speculation of my exit only strengthens my position: Bommai
119.article_body: Karnataka Chief Minister Basavaraj Bommai said that speculations about his replacement will only strengthen his position. Calling the rumours politically motivated, Bommai said, "I have come to accept the situation. I know the truth. I know that there is no basis for this speculation." Bommai's remarks come amid Congress party's social media messages stating that the BJP will replace him.

120.title: Spain evacuates another 294 Afghan refugees
120.article_body: The Spanish government has evacuated another 294 refugees from Afghanistan to the country, via Pakistan, officials said on Thursday. Since August last year, Spain has evacuated to Madrid 3,900 people from the war-torn nation. The evacuated persons include people who had worked for the Spanish government or its troops stationed in Afghanistan before the Taliban took over.

121.title: Do you think I have become old: Babar Azam to reporter asking if he should quit 1 format
121.article_body: After a reporter asked him if he should quit one format due to workload, Pakistan captain Babar Azam replied, "Do you think I have become old?" Babar added, "The kind of fitness that we have, I don't think we should limit ourselves to two formats." He further said, "If workload is high then we will increase our fitness levels."

122.title: MI Cape Town announce their first group of players for upcoming T20 league
122.article_body: MI Cape Town today announced the signing of five players ahead of the inaugural edition of Cricket South Africa T20 League. The players include Kagiso Rabada, Dewald Brevis, Rashid Khan, Sam Curran and Liam Livingstone. The players have been signed ahead of the auctions as per the rules that govern the T20 league, MI said.

123.title: Truck full of migrants overturns in North Macedonia; 35 injured
123.article_body: A truck carrying 49 Syrian migrants overturned on a road in North Macedonia, causing injuries to 35 people, police said on Thursday. The migrants are believed to have entered North Macedonia from neighbouring Greece. The truck driver escaped on foot from the accident scene on Wednesday and is suspected to be part of a migrant smuggling ring.

124.title: Was like hearing KK: Leslee Lewis on recording 'Yaaron' with KK's son
124.article_body: Music composer Leslee Lewis opened up on his experience of re-recording 'Yaaron Dosti' song with late singer KK's son Nakul and daughter Tamara. He said recording with Nakul was "unbelievable". "It was like I was hearing KK," he shared. The original version of the song, sung by KK, was recorded 23 years ago.

125.title: Shehbaz is very protective of me: Shehnaaz Gill
125.article_body: Bigg Boss 13 fame Shehnaaz Gill opened up about her relationship with brother Shehbaz. She said, "Shehbaz is very protective of me. Every brother-sister should be that for each other." Crediting Shehnaaz for his success, Shehbaz said he is 'very lucky' to have her in life. On the work front, Shehnaaz is set to make her Bollywood debut.

126.title: Congress MLA Sudip attacked in Tripura, hospitalised; party blames BJP
126.article_body: Congress MLA Sudip Roy Barman sustained head injuries on Thursday after being attacked by unidentified people during 'Bharat Jodo Yatra' in Agartala, Tripura. He's undergoing treatment at hospital. Tripura Congress blamed "BJP goons" for the attack on Sudip and other leaders. Congress' Birajit Singh said miscreants had thrown stones at Sudip's car. Other Congress members were also injured.

127.title: Scriptures like Manusmriti give respectable position to women: HC Judge
127.article_body: Delhi High Court judge Justice Prathiba M Singh has said that the Indian women "are a blessed lot" since scriptures like Manusmriti give a very respectable position to them. She added that India is more progressive about women being in leadership roles. Women are respected in Asian countries because of the cultural and religious background of scriptures, she further said.

128.title: 160 grams of heroin seized in Haryana's Ambala, 2 arrested
128.article_body: The police on Thursday arrested two men, Arvind and Vijay, with 160 grams of heroin from a village near Ambala cantonment in Haryana, officials said. Acting on a tip off, a police team stopped a car at a check post on Ambala-Delhi highway, they added. During the search, police recovered the drugs from two men, both residents of Ambala Cantonment.

129.title: 'Dream Girl 2' to star Ananya, Paresh Rawal, Seema Pahwa: Reports
129.article_body: The makers of 'Dream Girl 2' have reportedly shortlisted the cast of the film. As per a report, Ananya Panday, Paresh Rawal and Seema Pahwa will be joining Ayushmann Khurrana, who will be reprising his role. 'Dream Girl 2' is the sequel of 2019 film with the same name. It was directed by Raaj Shaandilyaa.

130.title: Shashi Tharoor to be conferred France's highest civilian award
130.article_body: Senior Congress leader Shashi Tharoor is set to be conferred with France's highest civilian award Chevalier de la Legion d'Honneur for his writings and speeches. French Ambassador to India Emmanuel Lenain wrote to Tharoor, informing him about the award. "I am honoured to be recognised in this way. My gratitude and appreciation," Tharoor said.

131.title: Dozens missing as migrant boat sinks off Greece's coast
131.article_body: A Greek navy vessel and three merchant ships were on a search and rescue operation on Thursday after a boat carrying migrants sank off the southeastern coast of Greece on Wednesday, officials said. Only 29 men from Afghanistan, Iran and Iraq have been rescued till now. Survivors told officials that 60 to 80 people were onboard the boat.

132.title: Cameroon troops killed 10 people in crackdown on separatists: NGO
132.article_body: Cameroonian troops "summarily killed" at least 10 people during President Paul Biya's crackdown on Anglophone separatists earlier in the year, a report by Human Rights Watch said on Thursday. "The troops also burned 12 homes, destroyed, and looted health facilities," the report stated. The report comes as fighting between security forces and militants have intensified recently.

133.title: Woman spends ₹48 lakh to look like Kim Kardashian in South Korea, pics surface
133.article_body: Cherrie Lee, 28, from South Korea has undergone 15 surgeries in eight years to look like Kim Kardashian. "Whenever I have to explain to someone that I'm Korean and they [say]...I don't look [like] it, I feel unique and exotic," she stated. She has spent £50,000 (over ₹48 lakh) on procedures including Brazilian butt lifts, breast augmentations and facial surgeries.

134.title: Centre waives off taxes for rich, but imposes it on poor: Kejriwal
134.article_body: Delhi CM and AAP national convener Arvind Kejriwal on Thursday attacked the Centre and said the Centre provides tax waivers for the rich, but overburdens the poor with taxes. "What was the condition of the central government that it was time to impose tax on the poorest of the poor?" Kejriwal questioned. Kejriwal further criticised the Centre's Agnipath scheme.

135.title: Nobody can force anyone to buy the national flag: Haryana CM
135.article_body: Amid reports that a Karnal ration depot compelled people to buy the tricolour, Haryana CM Manohar Khattar on Thursday clarified that nobody can force anyone to buy the flag. "No person will be denied...services even if he doesn't wish to buy the national flag. Under 'Har Ghar Tiranga Abhiyan', people can voluntarily buy the flag," CM said in a statement.

136.title: People took my self-confidence for arrogance: KGF actor Yash
136.article_body: Kannada actor Yash said his self-confidence made him what he is today. However, he said a few years ago, his self-confidence was mistaken for arrogance. "When I spoke with self-confidence like this a few years ago, some may have thought I was arrogant," he said. The 'KGF' star added that his belief in himself has brought respect to Kannada cinema.

137.title: 51-yr-old Norwegian woman staying illegally in India held in Manipur
137.article_body: A 51-year-old Norwegian woman has been arrested in the border town of Moreh in Manipur for illegally staying in India, the Assam Rifles said on Thursday. Mya Kyay Mon, who arrived in India in 2020, was intercepted at the foreigners' checkpost in Khudengthabi while she was travelling to Kolkata, it said. Her passport and visa had expired, it added.

138.title: He asked me to send girls to his bungalow every night: Hostel warden on MP SDM
138.article_body: A former warden of a government-run girls hostel in Madhya Pradesh's Shivpuri district alleged that the then-district coordinator Bijender Singh Yadav, who's currently an SDM, used to ask her to "send girls to his bungalow" every night. She added he used to threaten her with transfer in case his demands weren't met. An inquiry has been launched into the matter.

139.title: Woman spends ₹48 lakh to look like Kim Kardashian, says 'People don't believe I'm Korean'
139.article_body: Cherrie Lee, 28, from South Korea has undergone 15 surgeries in eight years to look like Kim Kardashian. "Whenever I have to explain to someone that I'm Korean and they [say]...I don't look [like] it, I feel unique and exotic," she stated. She has spent £50,000 (over ₹48 lakh) on procedures including Brazilian butt lifts, breast augmentations and facial surgeries.

140.title: Kejriwal has given 'perverse twist' to freebies debate: Sitharaman
140.article_body: Finance Minister Nirmala Sitharaman on Thursday took a jibe at Delhi CM Arvind Kejriwal, saying he had given a "perverse twist" to the debate on freebies as health and education were never considered giveaways. Sitharaman said that by classifying education and health as freebies, Kejriwal was trying to instil fear in the minds of the poor.

141.title: 4 killed, several missing as boat capsizes in UP's Banda due to strong winds
141.article_body: At least four people were killed and several went missing after a boat carrying around 35 people capsized in the Yamuna river in Uttar Pradesh's Banda. The boat capsized due to strong winds, the Superintendent of Police said. As per local residents, many of them were going to celebrate Raksha Bandhan with their siblings.

142.title: Rajiv Gandhi assassination convict moves SC for premature release
142.article_body: Nalini Sriharan, a life convict in former PM Rajiv Gandhi's assassination case, moved the Supreme Court on Thursday seeking premature release. She cited the court's judgement in the case where co-convict AG Perarivalan was released from prison. "Tamil Nadu [Council] had recommended [the] Governor to release the…convicts in 2018. But…the Governor sent the issue to the President," her lawyer said.

143.title: Self-driving Tesla Model 3 runs down child dummy in multiple safety tests
143.article_body: The Dawn Project CEO Dan O'Dowd has posted a video of a Tesla Model 3 equipped with Full Self-Driving (FSD) software running down a child mannequin placed in its path during safety tests. O'Dowd claimed there wasn't any interference or input from the test driver. He demanded a ban on FSD software until Tesla "proves it won't mow down children".

144.title: KL Rahul to lead India in 3-match ODI series against Zimbabwe, Dhawan named his deputy
144.article_body: Batter KL Rahul has been declared fit for the three-match ODI series against Zimbabwe, the BCCI said. Rahul will be leading the squad in the series, while Shikhar Dhawan, who was initially named captain, has now been named Rahul's deputy. The ODI series will begin on August 18, while the last ODI will take place on August 22.

145.title: Armed man takes Beirut bank staff hostage, demands his trapped savings
145.article_body: A Lebanese man armed with a shotgun has taken hostages at a Beirut bank and threatened to set himself on fire unless he receives his trapped savings to pay his father's medical bills. Soldiers and police converged on the area and sought a negotiation. Lebanon's cash-strapped banks since 2019 have put strict limits on withdrawals of foreign currency assets.

146.title: In veiled attack at Nitish, Minister shares clip showing dog fighting 2 lions
146.article_body: Union Minister Giriraj Singh, on Thursday, tweeted a video showing a dog trying to fight two lions and captioned it "Challenge 2024", which he later deleted. The video came a day after Bihar CM Nitish Kumar asserted that the NDA government needs to worry about the 2024 LS polls. "The RJD's plan to loot Bihar has begun," Singh said.

147.title: Pics of Kobe's remains after crash shared by police, firefighters for a laugh, court told
147.article_body: The pictures of Kobe Bryant's remains after the helicopter crash were shared by LA County police and firefighters "for a laugh", Kobe's wife Vanessa's attorney Luis Li told a court during Vanessa's invasion of privacy trial against the county. "They were shared by deputies playing video games...They were shared...with people who had absolutely no reason to receive them," he added.

148.title: TMC has become a party of thieves: WB Cong chief Adhir Chowdhury
148.article_body: After TMC's Anubrata Mondal was arrested by CBI in connection with the cattle smuggling scam, West Bengal Congress chief Adhir Ranjan Chowdhury said TMC has become a party of thieves. "CM Mamata Banerjee and TMC leaders are involved in scams," Chowdhury said. "Such scams are not possible without the support of government and the police," he added.

149.title: 27-year-old American tourist raped in public toilet in Paris
149.article_body: An American woman was allegedly raped in a public toilet in Paris on Saturday. The 27-year-old was walking with her boyfriend along the River Seine across Notre Dame Cathedral when she stopped to use a public bathroom at around 1 am. The suspect, a 23-year-old man, was charged with rape and kept in custody.

150.title: Self-proclaimed politician Shrikant Tyagi's bail plea rejected
150.article_body: A court has rejected a bail plea filed by self-proclaimed politician Shrikant Tyagi, who is accused of molesting and abusing a woman in Noida. He was arrested from Meerut on Tuesday after absconding for days. Tyagi's lawyer Sushil Bhati said they will now approach the sessions court to contest this judgment.

151.title: US Justice dept to sue Google next month over ad market domination: Report
151.article_body: The US Department of Justice (DOJ) is preparing to sue Google as soon as next month over the firm's alleged illegal domination of the digital advertising market, Bloomberg reported. Lawyers of DOJ's antitrust division are reportedly questioning publishers in another round of interviews to refresh facts. DOJ's previous lawsuit against Google alleged that it dominates the online search market.

152.title: ED, CBI can set up offices at my residence if it brings peace: Tejashwi
152.article_body: Bihar Deputy CM Tejashwi Yadav said he was far from being afraid of ED and CBI and was ready to let them set up offices at his residence if this brought peace. "If even this doesn't bring "shanti" (peace), I cannot help," Tejashwi said. He claimed he did not fear these agencies even during his first tenure as deputy CM.

153.title: 2 govt officials caught red-handed while accepting bribes in Assam
153.article_body: Police on Thursday said two government officials were caught red-handed while allegedly accepting bribes in Assam. Gopinath Das, working in the office of sub-registrar in Tamulpur, was caught while accepting bribe money, Anti-corruption and Vigilance director said. In the second incident, Lohit Phukan, working in the office of Inspector of Excise in Bokakhat, was apprehended with money, he added.

154.title: Suspected Maoists abduct, kill villager in Chhattisgarh's Bijapur
154.article_body: Suspected Maoists abducted and killed a villager in Chhattisgarh's Bijapur district, police said on Thursday, adding the reason behind the murder was yet to be ascertained. Security personnel on Thursday recovered the body of the deceased villager, Gopiram Madkam, near his village Kahurgaon, a senior official said. Madkam was abducted from his village on August 8, the official added.

155.title: Man, wife kill 4 relatives over property in Howrah: Police
155.article_body: A man and his wife allegedly killed four of their family members over a property dispute in Howrah, West Bengal, police said on Thursday. While accused Debraj Ghosh is on the run, his wife Pallavi Ghosh was arrested. The accused allegedly stabbed Debraj's mother, his brother, sister-in-law and niece on Wednesday night, officials said.

156.title: Tyre of Coast Guard's Dornier aircraft bursts at Goa airport
156.article_body: A tyre of an Indian Coast Guard Dornier aircraft has burst during routine tests on a runway at the Dabolim airport in Goa, an official said. The incident delayed several flights operating from the airport since afternoon. The Coast Guard functions from the INS Hansa naval base, which is also home to the Dabolim civilian airport.

157.title: Will beat him, set venue on fire: BJP MLA on Munawar's Hyd show
157.article_body:
After stand-up comedian Munawar Faruqui announced that he'll hold a show in Hyderabad,
BJP MLA T Raja Singh threatened to cancel the programme. In a video message, Singh said, "Wherever the programme is held, we shall beat him up...We shall set [the venue] on fire." He added, "We shall...teach him a lesson for abusing...Lord Ram if he comes to Telangana."

158.title: Influencer, who smoked inside flight, booked for drinking liquor in the middle of road
158.article_body: A case has been registered against social media influencer Bobby Kataria at Dehradun's Cantt police station for allegedly consuming liquor in the middle of a road in Uttarakhand. While sharing the video on Instagram, he had written, "It's time to enjoy on the roads." Earlier, a video of the influencer smoking inside a SpiceJet flight had gone viral.

159.title: Arjun Tendulkar to leave Mumbai, likely to play for Goa: Reports
159.article_body: Sachin Tendulkar's son Arjun Tendulkar will likely represent Goa in the upcoming domestic season, reports said. Arjun has applied for a No Objection Certificate from Mumbai Cricket Association. "Getting maximum game time...is important for him at this juncture of his career. We believe...the shift will improve...probability of him featuring in more competitive matches," SRT Sports Management said.

160.title: UP woman kills husband, buries body in house after quarrel: Police
160.article_body: A woman allegedly killed her husband and buried his body in their house after a quarrel in Uttar Pradesh's Khamaria on Sunday, police said. However, the woman told the police that her husband, Govind, hanged himself following the quarrel. She claimed that she got scared after Govind's death and dug a pit in their house and buried the body there.

161.title: No-confidence motion against Himachal govt defeated by voice vote
161.article_body: A no-confidence motion moved by Congress and CPI-M against the BJP government in Himachal Pradesh was defeated by a voice vote in the Assembly on Thursday. The Opposition MLAs walked out of the Assembly during Chief Minister Jai Ram Thakur's reply. They criticised the government over several issues, including law and order, unemployment and price rise.

162.title: Salman Khan spends a day with Indian Navy sailors, pics surface
162.article_body: Actor Salman Khan on Thursday spent his day with sailors of the Indian Navy onboard INS Visakhapatnam. The pictures of the actor have gone viral on social media platforms. In the photos, he is seen interacting, working out and dancing with the sailors. Salman is currently shooting in Hyderabad for his upcoming film 'Kabhi Eid Kabhi Diwali'.

163.title: It hurts: Raqesh on hate against Ridhi after split with Shamita
163.article_body: Actor Raqesh Bapat said it 'hurts' to think about the hate his ex-wife Ridhi Dogra is receiving after his breakup with Shamita Shetty. Fans blamed Ridhi for Raqesh-Shamita's split. "She has been getting the crap from the audience for no reason. When there's no truth to the fact," he said. He added a third person can never break a relationship.

164.title: Gurugram makes background checks must for bouncers after guests beaten up outside club
164.article_body: Gurugram Police Commissioner Kala Ramachandran on Thursday made police verification and background checks mandatory for all the security staff working in bars and clubs. This comes a day after bouncers at a club beat up some men for opposing the alleged molestation of their female friend. Action will be taken against those agencies that don't get verification checks done.

165.title: 4 transport 30 kg of ganja from AP to Hyd, arrested
165.article_body: Hyderabad's Rachakonda Police on Thursday arrested four persons of an inter-state gang and seized 30 kgs of ganja. The police arrested four of the seven-member gang and seized an auto and four mobile phones from them, all worth ₹9 lakh. One of the accused (Krishanaveni), has been peddling ganja for around four years, Rachakonda Police said.

166.title: Help us bring back body or get us visa: Brother of Indian woman who died by suicide in US
166.article_body: The family of Mandeep Kaur, who died by suicide in US allegedly over domestic abuse, is seeking help from government to enable them to either bring her body to India or arrange visa to perform last rites. However, as per the family, they haven't received any response from officials. "We...don't know what will happen with the body," said Mandeep's brother.

167.title: Four more held for attempting to kill TRS MLA in Hyderabad
167.article_body: The Hyderabad Police have arrested four more people for attempting to kill legislator, A Jeevan Reddy, of the Telangana Rashtra Samithi (TRS). The four accused - Santosh, Suguna, Surender and Sagar - aided the main accused, Paddagani Prasad Goud, in executing his plan to kill the MLA. Prasad Goud, a TRS leader, was arrested by the police on August 8.

168.title: 7 kidnap friend who won ₹1 crore in online games in K'taka, arrested
168.article_body: Seven people were arrested in Karnataka for allegedly kidnapping their friend, who won over ₹1 crore in online games. The accused called the victim's father and demanded ₹1 crore as ransom, which the father refused to pay, reports said. However, the accused settled for ₹15 lakh and threatened to kill the victim if the ransom wasn't paid.

169.title: Punjab CM accepts resignation of VC who was asked by minister to lie down on dirty bed
169.article_body: Punjab CM Bhagwant Singh Mann on Thursday accepted the resignation of Baba Farid University of Health Sciences, Faridkot, Vice-Chancellor Dr Raj Bahadur. He resigned on July 30, a day after Punjab Health Minister Chetan Singh Jauramajra forced him to lie down on a dirty bed at the university during an inspection. Dr Bahadur earlier said he felt humiliated.

170.title: Actor Vishal gets injured while shooting an action sequence: Reports
170.article_body: Actor Vishal got injured while shooting for an action sequence of his upcoming film 'Mark Antony'. As per the reports, the actor was rushed to a private hospital in Chennai. He has reportedly sustained a knee injury. The shoot of 'Mark Antony' is currently on hold. The actor will resume the shooting after his recovery.

171.title: Hyderabad on high alert ahead of Independence Day celebrations
171.article_body: Ahead of the Independence Day celebrations, a high alert has been sounded in Hyderabad after reports from the Intelligence Bureau. Following the reports, security at temples, mosques, tourist places, bus and railway stations and other crowded places has been increased. To monitor the situation, additional security forces have also been deployed at hotels and other public places in the city.

172.title: Trial of German soldier who faces Russia spy charges begins
172.article_body: A German soldier Ralph G. who allegedly shared information with Russian intelligence services has been put on trial. Ralph G. has been accused of sharing excerpts from an official government document on Germany's relationship with Russia in the wake of annexation of Crimea in 2014. According to reports, information was shared via phone calls, email and messaging service WhatsApp.

173.title: Randeep Hooda remembers Sarabjit's sister Dalbir on Raksha Bandhan
173.article_body: Remembering Dalbir Kaur on Raksha Bandhan, Randeep Hooda penned a note in which he mentioned how he is realising the significance of her rakhi. He said he is sure that her blessings are always with him. Dalbir pronounced Randeep her brother after he played the role of her late brother Sarabjit Singh in the 2016 film 'Sarbjit'.

174.title: Gujarat govt unveils drone policy, expects to create 25,000 jobs
174.article_body: The Gujarat government has unveiled a new Drone Promotion and Usage Policy for state departments and organisations, which is aimed at the promotion and use of drones for operations and delivery of services. The state government expects that this policy will create 25,000 jobs and attract investments. The policy allows different departments to use drones for various operational requirements.

175.title: Bengaluru Police files chargesheet in Rakesh Tikait ink attack case
