175.article_body: Bengaluru Police has filed a 450-page chargesheet in the case of a man throwing ink on Bharatiya Kisan Union national spokesperson Rakesh Tikait at Gandhi Bhavan in the city on May 30. The chargesheet records the accounts of 20 eyewitnesses and has named 89 witnesses. It also contains details on people who were arrested, including Hindutva activist Bharath Shetty.

176.title: Lebanon court orders property seizure of MPs charged over 2020 blast
176.article_body: According to reports, a Lebanese court has ordered temporary seizure of property owned by two parliamentarians who face charges in connection with Beirut port blast of 2020 in which more than 200 people were killed. Under the order, property worth about $3 million is to be confiscated. The exact charges have not been revealed but both parliamentarians deny wrongdoing.

177.title: Nitish Kumar created storm which can challenge BJP: Shiv Sena
177.article_body: The Shiv Sena on Thursday said Bihar Chief Minister Nitish Kumar had created a political "storm" by breaking ties with the BJP and this could challenge the BJP in the 2024 general elections. Sena's Marathi publication ‘Saamana’ also praised RJD leader Tejashwi Yadav. Kumar ended his government's alliance with the BJP in Bihar on Tuesday to form the 'Mahagathbandhan' alliance.

178.title: SoftBank looking to sell shares in FirstCry, valuing company at $4 bn: Reports
178.article_body: Japan-based SoftBank, and NewQuest Capital Partners are reportedly looking to sell shares of IPO-bound FirstCry in the secondary market. From the share-sale, the company is being valued between $3.5-$4 billion. As per a report, SoftBank which is the largest shareholder in FirstCry is planning to reduce its 29% stake to under 25% with the sale.

179.title: BJP leader's illegal structure demolished in UP after complaint
179.article_body: An alleged illegal structure belonging to BJP leader Satya Prakash Singh was demolished in Varanasi, Uttar Pradesh, by Varanasi Development Authority (VDA) on Thursday. Satya alias Akhand Singh is Varanasi BJP District Vice-President. VDA said a room had been built illegally in a housing society named Varuna Enclave in Sikraul. It was demolished after some female residents filed a complaint.

180.title: Andhra woman kills sister's daughter-in-law, reaches police with severed head
180.article_body: A woman in Andhra Pradesh's Annamayya allegedly killed her sister's 35-year-old daughter-in-law and reached the police station, which was about six kilometres away, with her severed head to surrender. Police suspect that domestic problems and property dispute led to the woman, Subbamma, killing the victim, Vasundhara. Subbamma's relatives were also allegedly involved in Vasundhara's murder.

181.title: Nitish made up his mind to quit NDA after call with Sonia Gandhi: JD(U) leader
181.article_body: Bihar CM Nitish Kumar made up his mind to quit NDA after he called Congress chief Sonia Gandhi to inquire about her health, a JD(U) leader said. "Kumar firmed up exit plan after getting Gandhi's nod for support," the JD(U) leader said, requesting anonymity. JD(U) leader VK Chaudhary said Kumar was also in touch with RJD chief Lalu Prasad Yadav.

182.title: What excuse will BJP give for increasing crime in Delhi: Chidambaram
182.article_body: Congress leader P Chidambaram criticised the Centre on Thursday over the law and order in Delhi and asked what excuses will the BJP give for the "alarmingly deteriorating" crime situation in the city. "Delhi registered 1,100 cases of rape in the 196 days of this year up to July 15. That is over 5 cases a day!" Chidambaram said.

183.title: Congress to hold 'Mehangai Chaupals', mega rally in Delhi over price rise
183.article_body: Congress has announced that it'll continue its fight against price rise by organising 'Mehangai Chaupal' meetings in all Assembly constituencies from August 17-23. A mega rally called 'Mehangai Par Halla Bol' will be held on August 28 at Delhi's Ramlila Maidan. Congress said state Congress committees will hold 'Mehangai Par Halla Bol-Chalo Dilli' events at state, district and block levels.

184.title: 3 more accused arrested in K'taka BJP youth leader's murder case
184.article_body: Three more persons accused in the murder of Karnataka BJP youth leader Praveen Nettaru were arrested early on Thursday morning, a senior police official said. "Earlier, we had arrested seven people who were part of the conspiracy," Mangaluru ADGP Alok Kumar said. Praveen Nettaru was hacked to death by bike-borne miscreants on July 26 in Dakshina Kannada district's Bellare.

185.title: 27-yr-old man dies after bike hits parked truck from behind in Surat
185.article_body: Police said that a 27-year-old man, identified as Vipul Mohan Parmar, died on the spot after his bike hit a parked truck from behind in Gujarat's Surat district on Wednesday night. Parmar was returning home after visiting his sister's house at Baben village as part of Raksha Bandhan celebrations, they added. Police have lodged a complaint against the truck owner.

186.title: Income Tax officials put 'Rahul weds Anjali' posters on 120 cars, conduct raids in Maha
186.article_body: The Income Tax officials carried out raids from August 1 to 8 in a secret manner at multiple locations linked to some business groups accused of tax evasion in Maharashtra's Jalna. The officials arrived at the locations disguised as baratis. Around 120 cars, with posters of 'Rahul weds Anjali', were used for the raids. They seized illegal assets worth crores.

187.title: Dreams of becoming PM made Nitish betray people's mandate: Ex-Bihar Dy CM
187.article_body: Former Bihar Deputy Chief Minister Tarkishore Prasad on Thursday alleged that Nitish Kumar's "dreams of becoming PM" made him "betray the mandate of the people" and join hands with the RJD. The BJP leader alleged that Kumar "went quiet" on the issue of corruption after joining the grand alliance, of which Lalu Prasad Yadav's RJD is a part.

188.title: Will closely cooperate with authorities to resolve BGMI ban: Krafton
188.article_body: Krafton will closely cooperate with authorities in India to reinstate the suspended battle royale game Battlegrounds Mobile India (BGMI), the South Korean firm's CFO Bae Dong-geun said on Thursday. "We fully respect and understand the Indian government's concern," he added. BGMI was pulled off Google Play Store and Apple App Store on July 28 following an interim government order.

189.title: 32-yr-old man steals idols of Hanuman, Durga from Mumbai temple; held
189.article_body: A 32-year-old man was arrested by the Shivaji Nagar Police for allegedly stealing idols of Hanuman and Durga from a temple in Mumbai's Govandi on August 3. The police said that the accused had escaped with two idols, adding that they were recovered after his arrest. The accused also stole a puja thali made of brass.

190.title: Binance says it is seeing surge in clients due to rising inflation
190.article_body: Binance is seeing a surge in clients due to rising inflation and a historically strong dollar that has depressed emerging market currencies, said Maximiliano Hinz, who heads Binance in Latin America. Hinz said Argentina, where annual inflation is at 90%, has emerged as one of Binance's top markets. "More people are seeking crypto...to protect themselves from inflation," Hinz said.

191.title: UN releases list of countries with highest digital currency ownership in 2021, India 7th
191.article_body: The United Nations Conference on Trade and Development has released a list of top 20 countries with highest digital currency ownership in 2021. Ukraine topped the list with 12.7%, followed by Russia (11.9%), Venezuela (10.3%), Singapore (9.4%), Kenya (8.5%) and the US (8.3%). India is seventh on the list, with 7.3% of the population owning digital currency in 2021.

192.title: Absolutely overwhelming: Actor Roshan Mathew on 'Darlings' success
192.article_body: Actor Roshan Mathew has thanked the audience for watching his latest film 'Darlings'. Calling its success "absolutely overwhelming," the actor said that all the "criticisms, debates and opinions" he has received from the audience will help him in the long run. 'Darlings' stars Alia Bhatt in the lead role.

193.title: Cisco hit by cyberattack, hacker tried to access corporate network
193.article_body: Cisco Systems said that a hacker tried to gain access to its corporate network and was preparing to encrypt files but couldn't manage to do so as it was detected and booted out. Cisco came to know of the potential compromise in May but revealed it on Wednesday after a list of stolen files was leaked on the dark web.

194.title: Oil price steadies after IEA raises 2022 demand growth outlook
194.article_body: After the International Energy Agency (IEA) raised its oil demand growth forecast for 2022 by 3,80,000 barrels per day, oil prices steadied on Thursday. Brent crude futures fell 7 cents to $97.33 a barrel, while US West Texas Intermediate crude futures eased 9 cents to $91.84. "Natural gas and electricity prices have soared to new records," the IEA said.

195.title: Pune Police arrest eatery staff for stabbing colleague to death
195.article_body: After an eatery employee, Sunil Namdeo Sarode, was found dead with stab wounds in Pune's Shirur, the Pune Rural police arrested his colleague from Maharashtra's Palghar, officials said. Investigation revealed that another eatery staff, Ananta Raghunath Kamble and Sarode had fought the previous night. "Kamble attacked Sarode with a butcher knife...and fled with the weapon," police said.

196.title: Sensex, Nifty end on strong note led by IT, realty, banking stocks
196.article_body: Benchmark indices ended on a strong note with Sensex up 515.31 points at 59,332.60 and Nifty at 17,659. Axis Bank, Bajaj Finance, HDFC, Tech Mahindra and TCS were among the major gainers on Nifty, while Tata Consumer Products, Apollo Hospitals, ITC, Hindalco Industries and NTPC slipped. Information Technology, PSU Bank, capital goods and realty stocks ended in the green.

197.title: Rahul Gandhi, Priyanka Gandhi share childhood photos on Rakshabandhan
197.article_body: Congress leaders Rahul Gandhi and Priyanka Gandhi Vadra took to Twitter on Rakshabandhan to share their photos from the past which included their childhood photos and a photo from Priyanka's wedding ceremony. Notably, Priyanka Gandhi tested positive for COVID-19 on Wednesday and has been isolating at home.

198.title: China’s vehicle sales rise 29.7% in July as COVID-19 curbs ease
198.article_body: Auto sales in China rose by 29.7% to 2.42 million units in July from the year-ago period. This was driven by the easing of COVID-19 restrictions and government incentives. The China Association of Automobile Manufacturers' data, however, showed that sales for the first seven months were still 2% lower than the corresponding period in 2021.

199.title: Video shows DMK councillor's husband trying to attack people with machete
199.article_body: A video showing Vetrichelvan, the husband of Tamil Nadu DMK councillor Nithya, trying to attack people with a machete following an argument has surfaced online. The argument took place as Vetrichelvan hadn't returned the ₹2.60 lakh he had borrowed from Gunasekara. While arguing, Vetrichelvan suddenly reaches for the machete and attempts to attack people while chasing them.

200.title: Married daughters also entitled to compensation by insurance companies: K’taka HC
200.article_body: Married daughters are entitled to compensation by insurance companies on the loss of their parents in accidents, Karnataka High Court has held. The Supreme Court has held that married sons are also entitled to compensation in such cases, the HC said. "The very contention that married daughters of deceased are not entitled for compensation cannot be accepted," the court stated.

201.title: Johnny Depp's 1st look from his 1st film after Amber Heard trial released
201.article_body: Actor Johnny Depp's first look as King Louis XV from the upcoming film 'Jeanne du Barry' has been released. It'll be Depp's first film since he won the defamation trial against his ex-wife Amber Heard. 'Jeanne du Barry' is directed by French filmmaker Maiwenn and its filming is said to have started at the end of July.

202.title: New equation will be formed in Bihar, wait & watch: RLJP chief
202.article_body: As Nitish Kumar took oath as Bihar CM for the eighth time, RLJP chief Pashupati Kumar Paras said a new equation will be formed in Bihar because in politics, equations are made and deteriorated. "There's a time of over three years and we have to wait and watch the situation. The Assembly polls in Bihar are in 2025," Paras added.

203.title: Country is sinking & you're talking about Bollywood: Anurag Kashyap
203.article_body: Reacting to a claim that 'Bollywood is sinking', filmmaker Anurag Kashyap said, "The country is sinking. The world is sinking and you're talking about Bollywood." He further spoke about the heat wave in Europe and the melting ice caps. "You won't see the Maldives in a while," the filmmaker said. Anurag's next directorial 'Dobaaraa' will release on August 19.

204.title: You're always worried about Kuldeep's consistency, Bishnoi more reliable: Styris
204.article_body: Ex-New Zealand all-rounder Scott Styris has said Kuldeep Yadav's consistency might be the reason for his non-selection in India's squad for the Asia Cup. "Kuldeep can fall off a cliff a little bit under pressure," he stated. Styris further said Ravi Bishnoi is "probably a little more reliable" and that's why the 21-year-old has been named in the 15-member squad.

205.title: AAP relishes in insulting athletes, soldiers: BJP's Shehzad Poonawalla
205.article_body: BJP’s Shehzad Poonawalla criticised AAP after Indian wrestler Divya Kakran shared certificate to prove she had represented Delhi at a tournament, after AAP MLA Saurabh Bharadwaj said Kakran always represented UP. "If there's one party that always relishes in insulting those who raise honour of our Tricolour, be it a 'jawan' (soldier) or a 'khiladi' (athlete), it's AAP," Poonawalla added.

206.title: Nitish-led govt's floor test to prove majority in Bihar Assembly on August 24
206.article_body: Nitish Kumar-led Bihar government's floor test to prove the majority in the state Legislative Assembly has been scheduled for August 24. This comes a day after JD(U) leader Nitish took oath as Bihar Chief Minister for the eighth time in his political career. Rashtriya Janata Dal's Tejashwi Yadav took oath as the Deputy CM of the state.

207.title: Karnataka HC puts on hold BBMP ward reservation till August 16
207.article_body: The Karnataka High Court (HC) has directed the state government and Election Commission to put on hold the Bruhat Bengaluru Mahanagara Palike's (BBMP) new ward reservation list for elections till August 16. The court direction came after hearing petitions that claimed flaws in the reservation list. The court on August 16 will decide whether an interim stay is required.

208.title: My 40-45 days spent on shooting are equal to 65-70 days: Akshay Kumar
208.article_body: Following recent claims that he lacks commitment after the failure of 'Samrat Prithviraj', actor Akshay Kumar said, "My 40-45 days [spent on shooting are] equivalent to 65-70 days." "I take the same time to finish...as others take...but I've divided it in the best way," added Akshay. "My eight hours are equal to 14-15 hours of any other star," he'd stated.

209.title: ED summons 8 West Bengal IPS officers in coal smuggling case
209.article_body: The Enforcement Directorate (ED) has summoned eight IPS officers of West Bengal to New Delhi for questioning in the coal smuggling case. These officers were reportedly deputed in the area where illegal coal mining and smuggling were occurring and they were aware of the racket. Earlier today, CBI arrested senior Trinamool Congress leader Anubrata Mondal in a cattle smuggling case.

210.title: Washington Sundar suffers shoulder injury ahead of Zimbabwe tour
210.article_body: India all-rounder Washington Sundar, who has been named in India's squad for Zimbabwe ODIs, injured his shoulder during Lancashire's Royal London One-Day Championship encounter against Worcestershire on Wednesday. "Sundar left the field after receiving treatment on his left shoulder following a heavy landing," Lancashire tweeted. Sundar hasn't played for India since his hand injury in IPL 2022.

211.title: Mumbai businessman cheated of ₹22 lakh in sim swapping fraud
211.article_body: A 47-year old Mumbai businessman was allegedly cheated of ₹22 lakh in a sim swapping scam, where fraudsters obtain a duplicate SIM of an individual after collecting their personal data. The businessman approached the cyber police and said his SIM card services were disconnected on August 4. After the services resumed, he found text messages for transactions worth ₹22 lakh.

212.title: Want to be professionally stable: Arjun on wedding plans with Malaika
212.article_body: Actor Arjun Kapoor said he wants to be "professionally a little more stable" before getting married to girlfriend Malaika Arora. He said he wants to do work that will make him happy. "Because if I'm happy, I can make my partner happy, I can live a happy life," he added. Arjun was the latest guest on 'Koffee with Karan 7'.

213.title: Every now & then Telugu industry calls for strike, it's temporary: Vijay
213.article_body: Actor Vijay Deverakonda opened up about the ongoing halt enforced on shoots in the Telugu film industry. "We have a system of unions there, every now and then they call for a strike for a few days," he said. Vijay added that the hold is temporary and shooting will resume in a week. Vijay will next be seen in 'Liger'.

214.title: 'Mass-termind' of entertainment: Karan Johar on Puri Jagannadh
214.article_body: Director Karan Johar has called Puri Jagannadh a 'mass-termind' of entertainment. The filmmaker said Puri has a "distinctive vision". "I'm still amazed at how he knits together such larger than life storylines so effortlessly," KJo tweeted. Karan is producing Puri Jagannadh's 'Liger', which stars Vijay Deverakonda and Ananya Panday.

215.title: Sonam Kapoor rates Bhumi, Kiara & Kriti as ‘underrated’ actresses
215.article_body: Actress Sonam Kapoor rated Bhumi Pednekar, Kiara Advani and Kriti Sanon as the "underrated" actresses of Bollywood. Sonam shared her thoughts during the latest episode of 'Koffee with Karan 7', which is hosted by Karan Johar. She was accompanied by actor Arjun Kapoor. Sonam also called Arjun's 'Ek Villain Returns' a "thirst trap" film.

216.title: CJI asks lawyers to wear masks in courtrooms amid rising COVID cases
216.article_body: Chief Justice of India (CJI) NV Ramana on Thursday advised lawyers to wear masks in courtrooms. "Please wear a mask. The majority of our staff and colleagues are getting COVID-19. Judges are also getting it," CJI, while hearing a PIL on freebies, told the lawyers. "I tested negative for COVID-19," Solicitor General Tushar Mehta said.

217.title: Axar's exclusion surprising, he did what was asked: Parthiv on Asia Cup
217.article_body: Ex-India wicketkeeper-batter Parthiv Patel said he's "surprised" about all-rounder Axar Patel not being picked in the squad for Asia Cup 2022. "He has delivered for the team whenever they wanted and did whatever was asked," added Parthiv. "Axar should've been picked as a backup for Ravindra Jadeja," he stated. India will face Pakistan in the tournament on August 28.

218.title: 3 SRK fans arrive in Mumbai, steal truck to return home; arrested
218.article_body: Three fans of Shah Rukh Khan arrived in Mumbai on Saturday to see the actor's bungalow in Bandra. After running out of money, they stole a truck in Bandra and were later arrested in Gujarat. They said they stole the truck to reach their homes, police said. One man was from Uttar Pradesh and the other two were from Haryana.

219.title: Can't beg people to play for WI: Head coach on players choosing leagues over country
219.article_body: Referring to several West Indian cricketers choosing T20 leagues over playing for their country, West Indies head coach Phil Simmons said, "It hurts. There's no other way to put it." He added, "But what can you do? I don't think that I should be begging people to play for their countries." He further remarked, "Life has changed."

220.title: China blocks India's bid at UN to sanction Pak terrorist behind Kandahar hijacking
220.article_body: China has blocked a move by India and the US to list Pakistan-based JeM leader Abdul Rauf Azhar as a global terrorist at the UN Security Council. Azhar is accused of being involved in the 1999 hijacking of an Indian Airlines aircraft in Kandahar, the 2001 attack on the Parliament and the 2016 attack on the IAF base in Pathankot.

221.title: 'Undemocratic, authoritarian': Cong leader on Lal Singh Chaddha boycott
221.article_body: Congress leader Digvijaya Singh on Thursday said that claims to boycott Aamir Khan's 'Lal Singh Chaddha' present an undemocratic and authoritarian ideology. "I believe #BoycottLalSinghChadha is trending. Why? Who is behind this? Who else but the ModiShah Troll Army! They are undemocratic, authoritarian and dictatorial. Working like a Robot," Singh tweeted.

222.title: 10 shops washed way in river after cloudburst in Himachal's Kullu; video surfaces
222.article_body: A cloudburst has been reported from the Kullu region of Himachal Pradesh on Thursday. A video showing 10 shops and vehicles being washed away in a river in Anni tehsil has surfaced online. Notably, two women were also buried alive under debris after their house collapsed in a landslide in the Kullu district on Thursday, officials said.

223.title: I was a brown face in vanilla line-up: Taylor on facing racist comments by NZ teammates
223.article_body: Ex-New Zealand batter Ross Taylor revealed in his book he was subjected to racially insensitive comments by New Zealand teammates. "Cricket in New Zealand is a pretty white sport...For much of my career I've been an anomaly...a brown face in...vanilla line-up," he said. "A teammate used to tell me 'You're half a good guy'," Taylor stated.

224.title: Rajasthan bans animal fairs after over 12,000 cattle die of lumpy skin disease
224.article_body: Rajasthan government has banned animal fairs after over 12,000 cattle deaths due to the lumpy skin disease were reported in the state. According to a report, 2,511 deaths have been reported in Sri Ganganagar followed by 1,619 in Barmer, 1,581 in Jodhpur and 1,156 in Bikaner. A total of 2,81,484 animals are reportedly affected due to the disease.

225.title: Man's relatives chop off fiancé's father's nose for calling off engagement
225.article_body: The relatives of a man in Rajasthan's Barmer allegedly chopped off the nose of his fiancé's father for breaking off their engagement. The victim, Kamal Singh Bhati, told police that he had fixed his daughter's engagement in the same family where his niece was married. However, following his niece's murder, allegedly by her in-laws, he called off his daughter's engagement.

226.title: Economy losing money, freebies distribution a 'serious issue': SC
226.article_body: The Supreme Court on Thursday observed that the promise and distribution of freebies by political parties during the poll season is "a serious issue", as the economy is losing money because of this. Chief Justice of India NV Ramana said that there's poverty in India, adding that the welfare of the people has to be balanced.

227.title: Singer Arjun Kanungo shares pics from his wedding to South African model Carla Dennis
227.article_body: Singer Arjun Kanungo took to Instagram to share pictures from his wedding to South African model Carla Dennis. "My words cannot express how much love we received and how special the day was for us," he wrote in the caption. The couple had reportedly been dating for more than seven years.

228.title: Film that started it all, turns 21 today: Farhan on 'Dil Chahta...'
228.article_body: Filmmaker-actor Farhan Akhtar took to Instagram after his film 'Dil Chahta Hai' completed 21 years of its release on Wednesday. "The film that started it all, turns 21 today...Thank you to the audiences who continue to give it so much love," he wrote. Farhan made his directorial debut with the film. It featured Aamir Khan and Akshaye Khanna.

229.title: Kohli desperately needed runs but backed India's new approach: Manjrekar
229.article_body: Former India batter Sanjay Manjrekar said Virat Kohli deserves credit for backing Team India's new aggressive approach during the recent T20Is against England despite being in desperate need of runs. "He did not care about whether he was...getting out," added Manjrekar. Discussing Team India's aggressive approach, Manjrekar stated that it comes more naturally to KL Rahul than Kohli.

230.title: Ukraine's Azov fighters to go on trial by summer end: Russia-backed official
230.article_body: Top Russia-backed official in Donetsk said on Wednesday that trial of captured Ukrainian fighters of Azov Regiment is likely to take place by the end of the summer in Mariupol. After fighting for weeks, Azov fighters surrendered to Russian forces in May. Russia's Supreme Court labeled the regiment as a terrorist organisation, clearing way for fighters to be charged formally.

231.title: Sanju behind in race for T20 WC spot, Hooda is definitely going: Aakash
231.article_body: Cricketer-turned-commentator Aakash Chopra has said Sanju Samson is "slightly behind" in the race for a spot in India's squad for the upcoming T20 WC. Aakash, however, said that all-rounder Deepak Hooda is a certain pick in the squad. "Hooda the hurricane, this boy is running ahead, this boy is not going to stop because he is definitely going," stated Aakash.

232.title: Snack centre in Pune looted over Dahi Handi contribution, 4 arrested
232.article_body: The Pune police on Thursday booked 10 persons for allegedly attacking and looting a snacks centre at Rahatani after an argument over financial contribution for the Dahi Handi festival celebration. Rahul Gupta, who runs Raj snacks and sweet centre, complained to the police stating the accused took nearly ₹10,000 from the shop. Police said they've arrested four of the accused.

233.title: 266 kg marijuana worth ₹66.5 lakh seized in Mumbai, 2 arrested
233.article_body: The Mumbai Police anti-narcotics cell (ANC) on Tuesday arrested two persons for allegedly transporting over 266 kg of marijuana worth ₹66.5 lakh. The accused were identified as Ashwin Kumar and Raju Lohar. "The team was waiting at the spot when two luxury cars were spotted...On searching, police found several bags of marijuana hidden under the seats," an ANC official said.

234.title: Tansa dam near Mumbai illuminated with Tricolour lights; video emerges
234.article_body: Brihanmumbai Municipal Corporation (BMC) has illuminated Tansa dam with Tricolour lights ahead of Independence Day. The dam, located near Mumbai, supplies drinking water to the people of the city. BMC said that the dam has been "creatively illuminated" as part of the 'Har Ghar Tiranga' campaign. The civic body also shared a video of the illuminated dam on social media.

235.title: Google opposes Facebook-backed proposal for self-regulatory body: Report
235.article_body: Google has reservations about a Facebook, Twitter-backed proposal for developing a self-regulatory body for India's social media sector, Reuters reported. An executive from Google-parent Alphabet reportedly said the company was unconvinced about the body's merits. The body would mean external reviews of decisions that could force Google to reinstate content, the executive reportedly said.

236.title: ICICI Bank briefly hits ₹6 lakh cr m-cap for 1st time; 7th Indian firm to do so
236.article_body: ICICI Bank on Thursday briefly recorded market capitalisation (m-cap) of ₹6.01 lakh crore with its shares hitting a record high of ₹866.15 on BSE. The bank has now become the seventh Indian firm to cross the ₹6-trillion-mark in m-cap. So far, Reliance Industries, Tata Consultancy Services, HDFC Bank, Infosys, Hindustan Unilever and Life Insurance Corporation have hit this achievement.

237.title: I've got used to trolls and hate comments: Priya Prakash Varrier
237.article_body: Actress Priya Prakash Varrier revealed she was a victim of trolls, memes and hate comments after a clip of her winking in the film 'Oru Adaar Love' had gone viral on social media. Speaking about dealing with it, she said, "It's...been tough for me initially but over time, I got used to trolls...hate comments and learnt to ignore unnecessary things."

238.title: Sehwag trolls Pak conspiracy theorist Zaid for mistaking Neeraj Chopra with Ashish Nehra
238.article_body: Virender Sehwag trolled Pakistani conspiracy theorist Zaid Hamid for mistaking Neeraj Chopra with Ashish Nehra. In a tweet praising Arshad Nadeem for winning gold at CWG, Zaid claimed Nadeem beat Nehra. "Chicha...Nehra is right now preparing for UK PM elections...So Chill," Sehwag wrote. "Neeraj (or as per him Nehra) participated at CWG. This is latest news!" a user tweeted.

239.title: Daughters of PMO workers tie rakhi to PM Modi, video surfaces
239.article_body: Prime Minister Narendra Modi celebrated Rakshabandhan with the daughters of PMO workers at his residence in Delhi. In a video shared by the PMO, the young girls are seen tying rakhi to PM Modi, some are also seen seeking his blessings after touching his feet. They are the daughters of the sweepers, peons, gardeners and drivers employed at the PMO.

240.title: US regulators deny broadband subsidies to SpaceX's Starlink, LTD
240.article_body: The US Federal Communications Commission (FCC) rejected Elon Musk-run SpaceX's Starlink and LTD Broadband's applications to receive more than $2 billion in internet service subsidies through a rural fund, the FCC said on Wednesday. The FCC further said that both Starlink and LTD Broadband gave inadequate answers to questions and are not capable of complying with commission requirements.

241.title: Akshay & I have a unique tuning to deliver meaningful films: Bhumi
241.article_body: Actress Bhumi Pednekar has said that actor Akshay Kumar has been a huge part of her acting career. "We have a unique tuning to deliver some meaningful films," she said. Speaking of 'Toilet: Ek Prem Katha' and 'Raksha Bandhan', Bhumi said that both the films can be watched with the family and deliver a message.

242.title: Go Fashion plans to open 120-130 stores every year
242.article_body: Go Fashion, the owner of women’s clothing brand Go Colors, reported a profit after tax (PAT) of ₹24.4 crore for the quarter ended June. It also said that it was working on expanding the brand across geographies by adding about 120-130 stores every year. Its total revenue surged to ₹165.2 crore from ₹31 crore in the corresponding period last fiscal.

243.title: Suspected militants attack jail in DR Congo, free over 800 prisoners
243.article_body: More than 800 prisoners have escaped after armed men attacked a prison in eastern DR Congo, authorities said on Wednesday. Fighters of the Allied Democratic Forces, a group linked to the Islamic State group, are being blamed for the jailbreak. Two police officers and a civilian were killed and part of the facility was damaged by a fire during attack.

244.title: Zerodha's Kite app faces technical snag in early trade
244.article_body: Stockbroking platform Zerodha’s mobile app Kite faced a technical snag as the markets opened on Thursday morning with several users taking to social media to complain about the same even as #zerodhadown trended on Twitter. The company shared an update at 9:21 am on its website to inform that the issue with its Kite mobile app had been resolved.

245.title: Just a phase: Maha minister on Nitish forming govt with RJD-led Grand Alliance
245.article_body: Maharashtra minister and Shiv Sena rebel camp leader Deepak Kesarkar has said that JD(U)'s alliance with the RJD-led Grand Alliance is "just a phase". He added, "JD(U) leader Nitish Kumar may reconsider his decision if he feels that he has picked the wrong party. That's not unprecedented." Nitish took oath as Bihar CM for the eighth time on Wednesday.

246.title: Noida-based startup SquadStack raises $17.5 mn in Series B round
246.article_body: Sales acceleration startup SquadStack has secured $17.5 million in a series B funding round led by Bertelsmann India Investments. The funding round saw participation of existing investors Chiratae Ventures and Blume Ventures. The Noida-based startup which was established in 2017, aims to use funds to hire more employees and increase its sales experts base.

247.title: Gurugram club manager, 6 bouncers arrested for beating up guests
247.article_body: At least six bouncers and the manager of Gurugram's club Casa Danza in Udyog Vihar have been arrested, police said. This comes after the accused allegedly beat up a manager of a multinational company and his friends for opposing the alleged molestation of their female friend. An argument had broken out between the bodyguards and the men, police added.

248.title: Several Chinese cities expand fresh restrictions amid COVID outbreak
248.article_body: Several Chinese cities imposed fresh restrictions and lockdowns to contain COVID-19 outbreak. Authorities in the manufacturing hub Yiwu, home to 1.9 million people, have announced three days of "silent management" in which some residents are confined to their homes and most are banned from leaving designated areas. People can step out for COVID-19 tests, grocery shopping and hospital visits.

249.title: What a joke, I had no desire of becoming VP: Nitish Kumar
249.article_body: Refuting the claim that he wanted to become country's Vice President, Bihar CM Nitish Kumar said, "You heard a man say…I wanted to be the Vice President. What a joke! It's bogus. I had no such desire." On Wednesday, BJP's Sushil Kumar Modi alleged Kumar dumped NDA as his ambition of becoming country's Vice President couldn’t be accommodated by BJP.

250.title: She'll win gold in 2024 Olympics: Telangana Sports Minister on Sreeja
250.article_body: Telangana Sports Minister V Srinivas Goud said Sreeja Akula, who alongside Sharath Kamal helped India win its first-ever table tennis mixed doubles gold at CWG, during CWG 2022, will win gold in the 2024 Paris Olympics. "We went into the mixed doubles competition without enough practice sessions because of the tight schedule," Sreeja had said after the mixed doubles gold.

251.title: Hindu family saves Muharram procession from fire near slain Kanhaiya Lal's shop in Udaipur
251.article_body: A Hindu family in Udaipur helped avoid a tragedy after a fire broke out on a 'tajiya' during Muharram procession near murdered tailor Kanhaiya Lal's shop. Ashish Chowadia, Rajkumar Solanki and their family members poured water on 'tajiya' from their balconies till the flames were doused, police said. "This incident has won everyone's heart," District Collector Tara Chand Meena said.

252.title: I would rather lose than win on a false promise: UK PM hopeful Sunak
252.article_body: UK's Prime Ministerial candidate Rishi Sunak said he'd rather lose the Tory leadership race to replace Boris Johnson than "win on a false promise". Sunak, in an interview with BBC, said he'd tell people what "they needed to hear" and stay "true" to his values. Sunak added that he's committed to helping the most vulnerable families with the cost-of-living crisis.

253.title: Civil Aviation Minister reacts after influencer seen smoking inside SpiceJet flight
253.article_body: Civil Aviation Minister Jyotiraditya Scindia has reacted after an influencer was seen smoking inside a SpiceJet flight. "Investigating it. There will be no tolerance towards such hazardous behaviour," Scindia said. Authorities have filed a police case against the influencer named Balvinder Kataria who had travelled from Dubai to New Delhi.

254.title: Babar Azam can become no. 1 batter in Test cricket: Mahela Jayawardena
254.article_body: Ex-Sri Lanka captain Mahela Jayawardena has said Pakistan captain Babar Azam can dethrone Joe Root as the number one Test batter in the near future. "Babar has been consistent in all three formats and it shows in his rankings. He's a naturally gifted player...he's got the game to adapt as well," stated Jayawardena. Babar is currently ranked third in Tests.

255.title: Was told 'You've to do something now': Akshay on last 2 films not working
255.article_body: Discussing the failure of his last two films 'Bachchhan Paandey' and 'Samrat Prithviraj', actor Akshay Kumar said, "People came...to me and said...'You have to do something now'." Producer Aditya Chopra, who produced 'Samrat Prithviraj', had reportedly blamed the actor's lack of "commitment". Reacting to such reports, Akshay had stated, "My eight hours are equal to 14-15 hours of other stars."

256.title: Central Railway adds Vistadome coach in Pune-Secunderabad Shatabdi Express
256.article_body: Central Railway has decided to add a Vistadome coach in Pune-Secunderabad Shatabdi Express, an official said. "Passengers will enjoy Ujani backwaters and dam near Bhigwan...relish the beauty of the forest as it traverses through Ananthagiri Hills," the official added. This would be Central Railway's fifth Vistadome coach which was first introduced in 2018 on Mumbai-Madgaon Janshatabdi Express.

257.title: 42 Malian soldiers killed, 22 injured in suspected militant attack
257.article_body: Forty-two Malian soldiers were killed and 22 others were injured in an attack near Tessit town on Sunday, Mali's government said on Wednesday. "The Malian army...reacted vigorously to a complex and coordinated attack by armed terrorist groups, presumably from Islamic State in the Greater Sahara (ISGS), characterised by the use of drones, explosives, car bombs and artillery," the government added.

258.title: Nadal set to return to competitive tennis at Cincinnati Open
258.article_body: Twenty two-time Grand Slam champion Rafael Nadal is set to return to competitive tennis at Cincinnati Open, which will begin on August 13. Nadal hasn't played since pulling out of the Wimbledon 2022 semi-final against Australia's Nick Kyrgios due to an abdominal tear. Nadal is the only one among the 'Big Three' who will participate at Cincinnati.

259.title: Kajal recreates scene from 'Baahubali' with son Neil for Rajamouli
259.article_body: Actress Kajal Aggarwal took to Instagram Stories and recreated a scene with her son Neil from SS Rajamouli's 'Baahubali'. In the picture, Kajal put Neil's feet on her head. "Rajamouli sir, this is Neil's & my dedication to you. How could we not," Kajal wrote along with the picture. Kajal and Rajamouli have previously worked together in 'Magadheera'.

260.title: Speak about darkness you've spread: Surjewala on PM's 'black magic' remark
260.article_body: Reacting to PM Narendra Modi's "black magic" remark, Congress' Randeep Singh Surjewala said, "Instead of cursing the Opposition, speak about the darkness you have spread too." Surjewala tweeted a video of PM Modi and wrote, "Dark clouds of back-breaking inflation! Dark clouds of unprecedented unemployment! Dark clouds over the sinking economy...Dark clouds hovering over stalling industries!"

261.title: Cried for the 1st time after hearing film's narration: Kareena on 'Laal...'
261.article_body: Actress Kareena Kapoor said she "cried" after listening to the narration of 'Laal Singh Chaddha', marking the first instance of her crying following a film's narration, in her career. "[It's] such a beautiful story," added Kareena. Actor Aamir Khan stated that he has not been able to sleep for the past one month due to stress over the film's release.

262.title: Eicher Motors shares clock 52-week high a day after Q1 results
262.article_body: A day after Eicher Motors reported a 157.5% jump in consolidated profit after tax (PAT) at ₹610.66 crore y-o-y for the quarter ended June, its shares opened over 3% up on Thursday clocking a 52-week high. The company sold 1,86,032 Royal Enfields in the quarter, which is a 52% rise from 1,22,170 motorcycles sold in the corresponding period last fiscal.

263.title: Woman dies after falling off 3rd floor in Delhi's Shakurpur; husband held
263.article_body: A 21-year-old woman died after falling off the third floor of her in-laws' house in Delhi's Shakurpur following which her husband was arrested, police said. This comes after her family raised the issue of her bad health with the in-laws which led to a quarrel, police added. The incident happened when the deceased's mother went to a police station.

264.title: Pak only care about the 2-3 games vs India, not Asia Cup: Ex-player Tauseef
264.article_body: Former Pakistan cricketer Tauseef Ahmed said Pakistan "don't really care" about the upcoming Asia Cup 2022. "We only care about those two-three games against India. It's like 'If we win these, that's it'," added Tauseef. "When something this crucial comes up, you go back to those players about whom you once said that they should leave cricket," he stated.

265.title: UP Police constable complains about food quality in public, breaks down; video surfaces
265.article_body: A video of a UP Police constable crying and complaining about the quality of the food served to the personnel is being widely shared online. In the video, constable Manoj Kumar said, "We're served such rotis after 12-hour duty...throw them to dogs, can your children have it?" Police, however, said Kumar faced disciplinary action on 15 occasions in recent years.

266.title: Singapore's GDP grows 4.4%, growth projections for 2022 downgraded
266.article_body: Singapore's gross domestic product (GDP) grew 4.4% year-on-year in the second quarter, the Ministry of Trade and Industry (MTI) said. It is lower than the 4.8% growth seen in the government's advance estimate. The government downgraded its growth projections for 2022 owing to cost pressures and global outlook risks because of the Russia-Ukraine war.

267.title: Pakistani woman's 'Should I kill my kids?' video goes viral amid rising prices
267.article_body: A Pakistani woman's video is going viral in which she is seen slamming the government after skyrocketing inflation. "What should I do, pay house rent, hefty electricity bills, purchase milk and medicines for my kids, feed my children or should I kill them?," she said in the video. "The government has almost killed the poor people," she further said.

268.title: Jagdeep Dhankhar takes oath as 14th Vice President of India
268.article_body: Former West Bengal Governor Jagdeep Dhankhar took oath as the 14th Vice President on Thursday. President Droupadi Murmu administered the Oath of Office to Dhankhar at the Rashtrapati Bhavan. Dhankhar clinched 528 votes and defeated Opposition nominee Margaret Alva, who bagged 182 votes in the Vice Presidential election.

269.title: Iraqi actress to sue The Economist over her photo in story about 'fat' Arab women
269.article_body: Iraqi actress Enaas Taleb is suing The Economist newspaper for using a picture of her to illustrate an article about Arab women being "fatter" than men. Taleb said that the image was used out of context without her permission, and violated her privacy. She also claimed it had been photoshopped. Taleb added that she faced "bullying comments" on social media.

270.title: Antarctica ice shelf crumbling faster than anticipated: NASA study
270.article_body: According to a NASA study, glaciers in Antarctica are shedding icebergs more rapidly than nature can replenish. Satellite analysis shows net loss of Antarctic ice is nearly as great as net amount of ice being lost due to thinning caused by melting ice shelves. "Antarctica holds 88% of the sea level potential of all the world's ice," lead author said.

271.title: PCB just wants to please the captain, player issues don't matter: Afridi
271.article_body: Ex-Pakistan all-rounder Shahid Afridi said the Pakistan Cricket Board (PCB) just wants to please the captain and agree to his demands. "Issues faced by players don't matter...The formation of a players association will be very beneficial," added Afridi. Afridi stated that ex-Pakistan captain Inzamam-ul-Haq had pushed for the formation of a players association but the PCB didn't agree to it.

272.title: Iranian who offered to pay $300,000 to kill ex-Trump adviser charged: US
272.article_body: The US has charged a member of Iran's Islamic Revolutionary Guard Corps (IRGC) with plotting to murder ex-President Donald Trump's former National Security Adviser, John Bolton. Shahram Poursafi offered $300,000 to individuals in US to carry out the killing, the Justice Department said. Poursafi was likely seeking revenge for 2020 US airstrike that killed IRGC commander Qassem Soleimani, it added.

273.title: Result of IAF Agniveer Recruitment 2022 phase 1 exam declared
273.article_body: The Indian Air Force has released the result of Agniveer Recruitment 2022 phase 1 exam. The candidates, who took the Air Force Agniveer Recruitment examination, can check and download their results online from the official website - https://agnipathvayu.cdac.in/. The candidates can access the IAF Agniveer Vayu Result 2022  online by logging in using their email id and password.

274.title: It's not true: Tiger Shroff on reports of dating Akanksha Sharma
274.article_body: Actor Tiger Shroff has reacted to reports stating that he is dating Akanksha Sharma, who was Tiger's co-star in his music video 'Casanova'. Speaking about the reports, Tiger told ETimes, "It's not true." Akanksha also featured with Tiger in 'I am a Disco Dancer 2.0'. This comes after Tiger and actress Disha Patani reportedly parted ways.

275.title: I thought 'Here we go again, another Tendulkar': Lee on bowling to Sehwag
275.article_body: Ex-Australia pacer Brett Lee has said when he thinks of the words "cruel, swashbuckling and unpredictable", he thinks of ex-India opener Virender Sehwag. "You'd bowl that beautiful line and length thinking I've got him...[but] Sehwag would go bang...[he] looked a little bit like Sachin Tendulkar when he was batting. And I thought 'here we go again. Another Tendulkar'," recalled Lee.

276.title: Delhi makes face masks mandatory in public places, ₹500 fine for violators
276.article_body: Delhi government has made the wearing of face masks in all public places mandatory. A fine of ₹500 will be imposed on violators, as per the official order. Those travelling together in private four-wheeler vehicles will not be fined, the order states. Notably, Delhi on Wednesday reported 2,146 new COVID-19 cases and eight deaths, the highest in nearly six months.

277.title: Economic crisis triggers violent anti-govt protests in Sierra Leone
277.article_body: People in the West African country of Sierra Leone have been protesting against rising inflation, increasing prices of basic goods, fuel shortage and other economic hardships. At least two police officers and one civilian died as anti-government protests in the capital Freetown turned violent. According to NetBlocks, Sierra Leone had only 5% of internet connectivity nationwide during protests.

278.title: Fraudsters lure couple to invest money, cheat them of ₹3 lakh in Pune
278.article_body: Fraudsters lured a couple from Pune's Dehu Road to invest money in a fake scheme and allegedly cheated them of ₹3 lakh. The accused had promised the victims returns of about ₹1 lakh every month, police added. The accused had been in touch with the complainant over the phone since April 16, 2022, police further said.

279.title: CBI arrests TMC leader Anubrata Mondal from his house in cattle smuggling scam
279.article_body: CBI on Thursday arrested Trinamool Congress (TMC) Birbhum district president Anubrata Mondal from his house in connection with the cattle smuggling scam. He was taken for a medical examination following his arrest. A CBI team on Thursday morning arrived at Mondal's residence in Bolpur. This comes after he failed to appear for questioning twice in three days.

280.title: Have grown up watching Aamir, took his films as reference points: Naga
280.article_body: Actor Naga Chaitanya said he has grown up watching 'Laal Singh Chaddha' co-star Aamir Khan's films. "Even before I became an actor, I...took his films as reference points for me, for my craft, to develop myself," he added. Naga stated that it was a "huge boost of confidence" for him as Aamir liked what he has added to the film.

281.title: Will have a special place in my heart: Preity on 21 yrs of 'Dil...'
281.article_body: Preity Zinta took to Instagram after her film 'Dil Chahta Hai' completed 21 years of its release on Wednesday. "A film where there was no place for a hero...heroine, just relatable characters that we could reach out...touch and laugh out aloud with," she wrote. Preity added that the 2001 film will "always have a very special place" in her heart.

282.title: Stop lowering dignity of PM's post: Rahul on PM Modi's 'black magic' remark
282.article_body: Congress leader Rahul Gandhi reacted to PM Narendra Modi’s "black magic" remark. "PM doesn’t see inflation...unemployment? PM Ji, stop lowering the dignity of the PM's post and misleading the country by talking about superstitious things like 'black magic' to hide your black deeds," Rahul tweeted. PM Modi's remark came in reference to Opposition's protest in black dresses on August 5.

283.title: Nitish Kumar not asset but liability to politics: BJP's Suvendu Adhikari
283.article_body: BJP leader Suvendu Adhikari on Wednesday said that Bihar CM Nitish Kumar is not an asset but a liability to politics. "BJP has benefited from what happened in Bihar. BJP and PM Modi's image helped Nitish Kumar to form government in Bihar in 2020," Adhikari added. BJP will make a government on its own strength in Bihar, Adhikari stated.

284.title: MP tribal man killed after forest officers open fire, murder case filed
284.article_body: A 33-year-old tribal man was killed and three others were injured after forest officers allegedly opened fire at them when they were allegedly chopping wood illegally in Madhya Pradesh's Vidisha, police said. "The officials confronted the people carrying wood...they abandoned their vehicles...started pelting stones," an officer said. CM Shivraj Singh Chouhan has ordered a judicial inquiry.

285.title: Amit Shah is backstage hero, has no desire for credit: Rajnath Singh
285.article_body: Union Minister Rajnath Singh on Wednesday said it will not be an exaggeration to say that Union Home Minister Amit Shah is a "backstage hero" who has no desire for credit. "He remains in the background and does so much work for the government as well as for the party and still gets time to study so much," Singh added.

286.title: Startups should focus on growth & profitability: Infosys Co-founder
286.article_body: Infosys Co-founder Nandan Nilekani said startups should not debate whether to chase growth or profitability, both should happen at the same time, in tandem with each other. Speaking at a startup summit hosted by Bengaluru-based firm xto10x, Nilekani advised startups to invest in its people and hire rightly. "I'm a strong believer in not spending...on customer acquisition," Nilekani added.

287.title: Only one among Karthik or Pant can play: Parthiv Patel on Asia Cup
287.article_body: Ex-India wicketkeeper-batter Parthiv Patel said one among Dinesh Karthik or Rishabh Pant can be part of the lineup during Asia Cup, if Rohit Sharma, Virat Kohli and KL Rahul are together included in the playing 11. Ex-Chairman of BCCI's selection committee Kris Srikkanth had earlier stated that he "doubts" whether Karthik will be picked in the lineup during Asia Cup.

288.title: Musk's lawyers seek to question Twitter team which counts bots: Reports
288.article_body: Elon Musk's legal team said Twitter must turn over names of employees who have been tasked to calculate what percentage of Twitter's users are bots and spam accounts, according to reports. Musk's lawyers reportedly asked for the names so that defence team can question them. Last month, Musk terminated $44 billion Twitter deal, saying the platform withheld information on bots.

289.title: India reports 16,299 new COVID-19 cases and 53 deaths
289.article_body: India has reported 16,299 new COVID-19 cases and 53 deaths in the last 24 hours, including four reconciled deaths in Kerala, according to the Ministry of Health and Family Welfare. India's active caseload stood at 1,25,076, while the daily positivity rate stood at 4.58%. The COVID-19 death toll in the country reached 5,26,879.

290.title: 10,000 people forced to evacuate as wildfires rage in France
290.article_body: About 10,000 people were forced to evacuate as wildfires tore through Gironde region of southwestern France on Wednesday. The fires have burned about 6,200 hectares of land so far. At present, dozens of wildfires are ablaze across the country, including at least eight major ones. France has been struggling this summer with successive heatwaves and its worst drought on record.

291.title: WB CID raids Jharkhand MLA Irfan Ansari's house, seizes ₹5 lakh in cash
291.article_body: West Bengal CID conducted a raid at Jharkhand MLA Irfan Ansari's residence at Jamtara and seized ₹5 lakh in cash. They also seized the SUV that was earlier used to bring ₹75 lakh in cash from Kolkata. WB Police on July 31 arrested Ansari and two other Congress MLAs after seizing ₹49 lakh in cash from a car.

292.title: Comedian Raju Srivastava on ventilator, critical after heart attack: Reports
292.article_body: Comedian-actor Raju Srivastava is "critical and on ventilator" at Delhi's AIIMS, news agencies ANI and PTI said quoting hospital sources. Following a heart attack on Wednesday, the 58-year-old was admitted to the hospital where he underwent angioplasty. Srivastava suffered a heart attack while working out at a gym.

293.title: Gold prices fall after US Fed officials hint at interest rate hike
293.article_body: Gold prices fell on Thursday as the dollar and Treasury yields rebounded after US Federal Reserve officials hinted at interest rate hikes despite the inflation in the US showing signs of cooling down. Spot gold declined 0.2% to $1,788.07 per ounce after touching its highest since July 5 at $1,807.79 on Wednesday, while US gold futures fell 0.5% to $1,805.10.

294.title: SAIL Q1 net profit falls 79% to ₹804 crore due to higher expenses
294.article_body: The Steel Authority of India Limited (SAIL) on Wednesday reported a 79% fall in its consolidated net profit to ₹804.50 crore in the quarter ended June as against ₹3,897.36 crore in the corresponding period last fiscal. Higher expenses by the company led to the decline as it increased to ₹23,295.23 crore as against ₹15,604.07 crore a year ago.

295.title: CWG medallist long jumper Sreeshankar finishes 6th on Diamond League debut
295.article_body: Commonwealth Games silver medallist long jumper Murali Sreeshankar finished sixth with his best jump of 7.94m on his Diamond League debut in Monaco. Sreeshankar had won the medal in Birmingham CWG with his best effort of 8.08m. Maykel Masso of Cuba won the event with an 8.35m jump while Olympic champion Miltiadis Tentoglou of Greece finished second with 8.31m.

296.title: It's hard to digest: Harmanpreet Singh on 'bitter' 0-7 loss vs Aus
296.article_body: Harmanpreet Singh, who is the vice-captain of the Indian men's hockey team, said it is "hard to digest" the team's 0-7 loss against Australia in their gold medal match at CWG 2022. "The entire team is disappointed by how we played," added Harmanpreet. Ex-Indian men's hockey team captain Viren Rasquinha earlier tweeted that the loss had left him "really heartbroken".

297.title: Don't beat around the bush: Priyanka on PM Modi's 'black magic' remark
297.article_body: Congress leader Priyanka Gandhi Vadra reacted to PM Narendra Modi's "black magic" remark. "PM Narendra Modi Ji, don't beat around the bush, tell people why you looted them by increasing prices?" Priyanka tweeted. Referring to Opposition's protest in black dresses on August 5, PM Modi said those who believe in black magic will never be able to earn people's trust.

298.title: Sensex jumps 585 points, Nifty above 17,700 in opening trade
298.article_body: Benchmark indices opened in green on Thursday with Sensex and Nifty surging 585.21 points and 161.40 points, respectively. The Sensex opened at 59,402.50 points and Nifty at 17,696.20. Eicher Motors, Tech Mahindra, Wipro, ICICI Bank and Infosys were among the major Nifty gainers, while Hindalco Industries, Tata Consumer Products, Divis Labs, Apollo Hospitals and SBI Life Insurance slipped.

299.title: There was a 'lot' of pressure: CWG 2022 gold medallist Lakshya Sen
299.article_body: India's 20-year-old shuttler Lakshya Sen, who helped the nation win its 20th gold medal at CWG 2022, said, "There was a lot of pressure this time because of past results." "I knew it wasn't going to be easy...[but believed] that I could go all the way," added Lakshya. Lakshya took off his jersey in celebration after winning the gold medal.

300.title: Anyone can announce free fuel, it will prevent India from becoming self-reliant: PM Modi
300.article_body: PM Narendra Modi on Wednesday inaugurated the second generation ethanol plant in Haryana, saying that anyone can announce to give free petrol and diesel but such steps take away our children's rights and prevent the country from becoming self-reliant. He also added, "Selfish announcements of freebies will increase burden on honest taxpayers and prevent investment in new technologies."

301.title: 'Who cares?': Nancy Pelosi laughs off Chinese sanctions over Taiwan visit
301.article_body: US House Speaker Nancy Pelosi on Wednesday laughed off China's move to impose sanctions on her and her immediate family members over the Taiwan visit, saying, "Who cares?" She added, "That's incidental to me, of no relevance whatsoever." Pelosi also defended her trip and said, "We went there to praise Taiwan...to show our friendship, to say China cannot isolate Taiwan."

302.title: Pant seemingly responds to Urvashi's interview about 'RP', says 'Leave me alone, sister'
302.article_body: Cricketer Rishabh Pant seemingly responded to actress Urvashi Rautela's recent viral interview wherein she talked about how a person named 'RP' wanted to meet her in Delhi and how she missed his calls 16-17 times. "It’s funny how people lie in interviews just for...meagre popularity and for hitting headlines," he wrote. "Mera picha chorho...behen (Leave me alone, sister)," he added.

303.title: Nitish Kumar told Amit Shah 'not to worry' a day before breaking alliance: Sushil Modi
303.article_body: Senior BJP leader Sushil Kumar Modi on Wednesday said Union Home Minister Amit Shah had called Bihar Chief Minister Nitish Kumar a day before he parted ways with the party and joined hands with the RJD-led Grand Alliance. Modi said Kumar had assured Shah that he had "nothing to worry about".

304.title: Absconding Kerala Congress councillor arrested in sexual assault case
304.article_body: A Congress councillor from Kerala's Kannur, who is accused in a sexual assault case and was allegedly absconding for the last two weeks, was arrested from Karnataka's Bengaluru on Tuesday night, police said. This comes after a female employee of a women's cooperative bank, reportedly controlled by the Congress party, had filed a case against him for alleged sexual assault.

305.title: I will give her a hug: Naga Chaitanya on if he meets ex-wife Samantha
305.article_body: Actor Naga Chaitanya, during an interview, revealed what his reaction would be if he met his ex-wife Samantha Ruth Prabhu. "I'll say hi...give her a hug," he said. This comes after Samantha, during her appearance on 'Koffee With Karan 7', had said, "If you put us both in a room, you've to hide sharp objects? Yeah. As of now, yes."

306.title: Harika shares pic after winning bronze at Chess Olympiad while being 9 months pregnant
306.article_body: Grandmaster Harika Dronavalli shared a picture of herself after winning bronze at Chess Olympiad while being nine months pregnant. "I always dreamt about being on podium...and finally made it," she wrote. She added, "It's more emotional because I made it at 9 months of pregnancy." She wrote, "No baby showers...no parties...no celebrations...I decided everything will be...after winning the medal."

307.title: I've not felt anything like that: Gulshan on insider vs outsider debate
307.article_body: Actor Gulshan Devaiah opened up about the insider versus outsider debate and said that he has not felt anything like that in the film industry. "When I started working here, I felt that this place, this town has given me a space," he added. Gulshan further said that he might be in a small space but that is his space.

308.title: Real Madrid beat Eintracht 2-0 for record-equalling 5th UEFA Super Cup win
308.article_body: Real Madrid defeated Eintracht Frankfurt 2-0 to win the UEFA Super Cup for a record-equalling fifth time. AC Milan and Barcelona also have five Super Cup wins. In the match, David Alaba opened the scoring for Madrid and Karim Benzema doubled the lead in the 65th minute. Notably, Benzema has now become the second-highest goalscorer for Real Madrid.

309.title: BJP should have made Sushil Modi Bihar CM in 2020: Nitish Kumar
309.article_body: Bihar Chief Minister Nitish Kumar said that BJP should have made Sushil Kumar Modi the CM of the state after the 2020 Assembly elections. "Had he been appointed to the post, things would not have reached this stage," he added. This comes after Nitish ended the alliance with BJP in Bihar. Notably, Modi has previously served as Bihar's Deputy CM.

310.title: Unfortunate that only few people aware of constitutional rights: Outgoing CJI
310.article_body: Outgoing CJI NV Ramana on Wednesday said that the public must know their constitutional rights and duties. "It's unfortunate that we are now celebrating 75 years of independence but still only a few selected people in the urban areas or the legal professional are aware of the constitutional rights and duties and the constitutional principles," Ramana added.

311.title: I'm a drama queen, Suhana is the softest, Shanaya is sincere: Ananya
311.article_body: Actress Ananya Panday opened up about her relationship with Suhana Khan and Shanaya Kapoor and said that they are like sisters. "The three of us are similar but we all have something very unique in each of us," she said. Ananya added, "I'm a full-on drama queen. I'm very dramatic...Suhana is the softest...most loving. Shanaya is extremely hard-working and sincere."

312.title: 3 soldiers martyred in terrorist attack at Army camp in J&K; 2 terrorists killed
312.article_body: Three Army personnel were martyred and two terrorists were killed when the terrorists attempted to infiltrate the Army camp in Jammu and Kashmir's Rajouri, an Army official said on Thursday. According to some reports, two more soldiers were injured in the terrorist attack. The attack comes ahead of the Independence Day celebrations.

313.title: I hate it: Suniel Shetty on calls to boycott 'Laal...', 'Raksha...'
313.article_body: Actor Suniel Shetty said he "hates" the calls to boycott 'Laal Singh Chaddha' and 'Raksha Bandhan', which star Aamir Khan and Akshay Kumar respectively. "It's unfair...Let's not destroy an industry that has its own legacy of good people and people who probably at some stage make mistakes," added Suniel. "There are a lot of people feeding off us," he stated.

314.title: Engineer arrested by CBI for demanding bribe of ₹2.5 lakh in Maharashtra
314.article_body: The Central Bureau of Investigation (CBI) has arrested an engineer of Utility Powertech Ltd in Maharashtra's Solapur for allegedly demanding a bribe of ₹2.5 lakh and accepting an initial amount of ₹1 lakh from a contractor. "The accused has been...looking after the safety and accounts-related issues in the absence of a regular accountant," a release from CBI stated.

315.title: 2 in cargo theft racket held with home appliances worth ₹23 lakh in Pune
315.article_body: Pune's Kondhwa Police busted an inter-state cargo theft racket and arrested two persons with home appliances worth ₹23 lakh. This comes after various electronic home appliances loaded on a cargo container which was parked in Gokul Nagar were stolen. "Nagpur and Hyderabad Police are looking for (the accused) in almost 20 theft cases registered there," Kondhwa Police said.

316.title: Set up a body led by PM Modi, Pope to end wars around the world: Mexico President
316.article_body: Mexican President Andres Manuel Lopez Obrador has said he'll submit a proposal to UN for setting up a commission, comprising PM Narendra Modi, Pope Francis and UN chief. Obrador added the aim of the commission would be to present a proposal to "stop wars around the world and reach an agreement to seek a truce for at least five years".

317.title: 2 brothers held for killing ragpicker over 'bidi' in Delhi's Daryaganj
317.article_body: Delhi Police arrested two brothers, aged 21 and 19, for allegedly stabbing a ragpicker to death in a fight over 'bidi' in the Daryaganj area. The accused, who are also ragpickers, had asked the victim for a smoke, police said. The victim refused them 'bidi' and allegedly cussed at them which led to a quarrel, police further said.

318.title: Satish Shah shares pic claiming Indian flag in it is from 1942, Twitter users correct him
318.article_body: Actor Satish Shah shared a picture with an Indian flag, tweeting, "The very same TIRANGA DHWAJ my mother had got during Quit India Movement 1942." "This version of the flag was adopted in 1947...in 1942 it was the INC flag with...spinning wheel," a user wrote. "A little bit of research...would've saved you the embarrassment of being proven wrong," another commented.

319.title: 20-year-old Will Smeed smashes The Hundred's first hundred
319.article_body: Birmingham Phoenix opener Will Smeed has become the first cricketer to smash a hundred in The Hundred. The 20-year-old slammed an unbeaten 101 off 50 deliveries against Southern Brave on Wednesday. His knock included six sixes and eight fours. The previous highest score in The Hundred was 92*(40), registered by Birmingham Phoenix's Liam Livingstone against Northern Superchargers last year.

320.title: Disney overtakes Netflix as total subscribers reach 221 million
320.article_body: Walt Disney Co surpassed Netflix Inc with a total of 221 million streaming subscribers at the end of the most recent quarter. Netflix said it had 220.7 million streaming subscribers. "We continue to transform entertainment as we near our second century, with compelling new storytelling across our many platforms," said  Bob Chapek, Chief Executive Officer, The Walt Disney Company.

321.title: North Korea declares victory over COVID-19
321.article_body: North Korean leader Kim Jong-un declared victory in the battle against COVID-19 on Thursday, with the leader's sister revealing he had suffered from fever. Kim ordered a lifting of maximum anti-epidemic measures imposed in May. "North Korea must maintain a steel-strong anti-epidemic barrier and intensifying the anti-epidemic work until the end of the global health crisis," he said.

322.title: Elon Musk teases 'X.com' as a potential social media site of his own
322.article_body: Responding to a Twitter user who asked, "Have you thought about creating your own social platform? If Twitter deal doesn't come through," Elon Musk replied with a website domain - X.com. The comment came after he sold 7.92 million Tesla shares worth $6.9 billion. Musk said he sold the shares to avoid emergency sale if Twitter forces deal to close.

323.title: Life is not 'Bigg Boss': Raqesh on break-up with Shamita
323.article_body: Shamita Shetty and Raqesh Bapat opened up about why they decided to break up. While Shamita said she wanted to focus more on herself than 'ShaRa,' Raqesh said if they were in the Bigg Boss house, people would have seen why things didn't work out between them. "Life is not just the Bigg Boss house," he concluded.

324.title: Man poses as ED official, demands ₹3 cr from ex-MLA; held in Punjab
324.article_body: A man has been arrested in Punjab for allegedly demanding ₹3 crore from former MLA Navtej Singh Cheema by impersonating as an official of the Enforcement Directorate (ED). In his complaint, Cheema had alleged that the man threatened to implicate him in a money laundering case if the money was not paid. The accused has been identified as Aman Sharma.

325.title: Easebuzz gets RBI in-principle approval for aggregating payments
325.article_body: Payments platform Easebuzz has received in-principle approval from the Reserve Bank of India (RBI) for Payment Aggregator (PA) authorisation. In March 2020, the RBI issued guidelines to regulate the Payment Aggregators (PAs) and Payment Gateways (PGs) to facilitate payments in the online space. Easebuzz joins Razorpay, Stripe, Pine Labs and MSwipe that have received in-principle approval.

326.title: US Defense Secretary pledges military support to Baltics
326.article_body: US Defense Secretary Lloyd Austin on Wednesday said the US wants to hold more military exercises with Latvia and other Baltic nations. Austin, who is currently on a visit to Riga, said the US may even bring additional American troops to bolster the region against any Russian threat. Austin's visit comes as Russia's invasion of Ukraine enters its sixth month.

327.title: They want more sponsorship: Gavaskar on demand to allow Indian players in foreign leagues
327.article_body: Talking about foreign ex-cricketers demanding Indian players' presence in foreign leagues, Sunil Gavaskar said, "They want their leagues to have more sponsorship." He added, "They're concerned about their cricket." He stated, "When Indian cricket looks to protect its cricket by ensuring...players stay fresh...& thus restrict...them from playing overseas...that's not acceptable to...'old powers'."

328.title: Delhi airport installing IoT devices on its vehicles
328.article_body: The Delhi International Airport Limited is installing internet-of-things (IoT) devices on vehicles it operates at Indira Gandhi International Airport to enhance safety and save fuel, according to a statement on Wednesday. The IoT devices can also track location of vehicles and schedule maintenance, it noted. The devices will help in saving 23% fuel in utility vehicles and airside operations.

329.title: Infighting among pro-government forces in Yemen kill 35 troops
329.article_body: Clashes among pro-government Yemeni forces killed 35 troops in the last 24 hours in southern Shabwa province, officials said. Artillery fighting took place near an airport in Ataq city on Tuesday and five civilians were also killed. The fighting comes after weeks of tension within the Saudi-led pro-government forces, which have been fighting the Iran-backed Houthi rebels since 2015.

330.title: ASI suspended, 2 policemen shunted out for assaulting Raj school owner
330.article_body: An Assistant Sub-Inspector (ASI) has been suspended and two other policemen have been shunted to police lines for allegedly assaulting the owner of a private school in Bikaner, Rajasthan. Officials said that ASI of Gangashahar Police Station Bhawani Dan and two constables assaulted the school owner for not issuing transfer certificate to a student.

331.title: 'Haqeeqat' is the most patriotic war film to be made: Shekhar Kapur
331.article_body: Ahead of the 76th Independence Day, director Shekhar Kapur remembered Chetan Anand's 'Haqeeqat'. The filmmaker said the 1964 release is "the most realistic and patriotic war film to be made in India". He said the film will move the audience to tears and fill them with pride for the Indian Armed Forces. 'Haqeeqat' was based on the 1962 Sino-Indian war.

332.title: COVID-19 deaths fell by 9% worldwide in last week: WHO
332.article_body: The World Health Organization (WHO) on Wednesday said the number of COVID-19 deaths fell by 9% in the last week globally, while rate of fresh cases remained relatively stable. The UN agency said over 14,000 COVID-19 deaths were reported last week and around 7 million new infections were detected. The WHO cautioned the omicron sub-variant BA.5 remains dominant globally.

333.title: Zomato lowers Blinkit investment guidance to $320 million
333.article_body: Food delivery platform and restaurant aggregator Zomato has lowered the investment guidance in quick commerce company Blinkit from $400 million to $320 million for getting the business to breakeven, said Zomato CFO Akshant Goyal. Zomato is targeting adjusted EBITDA breakeven for its overall business by Q4 of FY 2023 or Q2 of FY 2024. Zomato acquired Blinkit in June 2022.

334.title: U'khand CM takes 'Har Ghar Tiranga' campaign near Indo-China border
334.article_body: Uttarakhand Chief Minister Pushkar Singh Dhami took the Centre's 'Har Ghar Tiranga' campaign to the tribal villages in the state's Chamoli district on the India-China border. Army jawans and residents of the villages participated in the campaign by holding national flags and chanted 'Bharat Mata ki Jai'. Dhami called 'Har Ghar Tiranga' a campaign of each and every individual.

335.title: 17% rise in crimes against women in Delhi; average of 6 rape cases daily
335.article_body: Delhi recorded a 17% increase in crimes against women in the first six-and-a-half months of 2022 compared to the same period last year, according to police data. In this period, the city registered 1,100 rape cases, averaging six rape cases daily. Cases of assault on women rose by almost 19% and cruelty by husbands and in-laws increased by 29%.

336.title: 9 Indian fishermen arrested for fishing in Sri Lankan waters
336.article_body: Nine Indian fishermen from Tamil Nadu were arrested for allegedly trespassing and fishing in Sri Lankan waters. The fishermen were from Nagapattinam and are being taken to Trincomalee port, Rameswaram Police said. Sri Lankan Navy had rescued six Indian fishermen who were left stranded due to a mechanical glitch in their boat, earlier this month.

337.title: Donald Trump declines to testify in probe into Trump Organization
337.article_body: Former US President Donald Trump declined to testify in a civil probe into his family's business practices at the New York Attorney General's office on Wednesday. Real estate company The Trump Organization is charged with overstating the values of its assets to obtain favourable loans. "I declined to answer...under the rights and privileges...afforded to every citizen," Trump said.

338.title: Govt didn't instruct denial of ration to people not buying national flag: PIB
338.article_body: Press Information Bureau (PIB) on Tuesday said posts claiming that the Centre instructed denial of ration to people who weren't buying the national flag are false. The clarification came after a video purportedly showing some people alleging that they were forced to buy a national flag to get ration went viral. PIB said the "errant" ration shop has been suspended.

339.title: Nitish's aides approached Bihar BJP over his wish to become VP: Sushil Modi
339.article_body: BJP MP and former Bihar Deputy CM Sushil Kumar Modi has claimed that some of Bihar CM Nitish Kumar's aides had approached Bihar BJP leadership over Kumar's wish to become India's Vice President. "This shows Nitish did nurse national ambition," Modi said. "We're stunned at what he did and the manner in which he broke up with us," Modi added.

340.title: Respect needs to be earned: Charu Asopa on Rajeev Sen
340.article_body: Actress Charu Asopa has said that her husband Rajeev Sen's lies about her have caused her immense hurt. Talking about her relationship with Rajeev, Charu said that while she will always pray for his happiness, "respect is something that needs to be earned". She added that nothing can be sorted out between the two.

341.title: China 'firmly opposes' new US law on processor chips
341.article_body: China on Wednesday said it "firmly opposes" a recently signed US law which encourages domestic producers of processor chips to reduce dependence on Asian suppliers. This week, US President Joe Biden promised $52 billion in grants to investors in chip factories in the US. China said this will "disrupt international trade and distort global semiconductor supply chains".

342.title: If a filmmaker makes film about temple, it's termed casteist: Karthi
342.article_body: Tamil actor Karthi will next be seen in M Muthaiya's 'Viruman'. The filmmaker was earlier criticised for allegedly glorifying casteism. When asked about it, Karthi said, "If a filmmaker wants to make a movie about a temple, it is termed casteist. Then no one can make films about any culture." He added, "One can only make films about his culture."

343.title: 'Darlings' to be adapted in Tamil & Telugu
343.article_body: Alia Bhatt's maiden production 'Darlings' is set to be remade in Telugu and Tamil. Gaurav Verma, producer and COO, Red Chillies Entertainment, confirmed the development. He said the story will remain the same but it will be adapted as per the local sensibilities. "Of course, there will be language barriers, but we will make sure it's done correctly," he said.

344.title: 9 Russian warplanes destroyed in Crimea: Ukraine
344.article_body: Ukraine’s air force on Wednesday said nine Russian warplanes were damaged in a string of explosions it carried out in Crimea on Tuesday. Russia has denied any attack in Crimea and rubbished reports of any damage to its aircraft. Russia has used the air base in Crimea to attack southern Ukraine in the ongoing war.

345.title: Ripple Labs 'interested' in bankrupt crypto lender Celsius' assets
345.article_body: Blockchain payments firm Ripple Labs is "interested" in potentially purchasing assets of bankrupt Celsius network, a company spokesperson said. Declining to say if Ripple was interested in acquiring Celsius, the spokesperson said, "We're interested in learning...whether [Celsius' assets] could be relevant to our business." "Ripple has continued to grow exponentially," the spokesperson added.

346.title: UP govt to provide free bus travel for women aged above 60: CM
346.article_body: Uttar Pradesh CM Yogi Adityanath on Wednesday said that the state government is considering to provide free bus travel for women aged above 60 on state-run buses. He made the statement at an event organised to flag off 150 new diesel buses. "We are providing free bus service for women from [Wednesday-Friday] on the occasion of Raksha Bandhan," he said.

347.title: Singer Arjun Kanungo gets married to Carla Dennis, pics surface
347.article_body: Singer Arjun Kanungo tied the knot with his girlfriend, South African model Carla Dennis in Mumbai on Wednesday. They got married in an intimate ceremony in the presence of their family members and close friends. While Arjun can be seen dressed in an ivory sherwani, Carla wore a red bridal lehenga. The couple reportedly dated for over seven years.

348.title: 2 Pakistani boxers go missing in UK after Commonwealth Games 2022
348.article_body: Two Pakistani boxers have gone missing in Birmingham after the conclusion of the Commonwealth Games, Pakistan Boxing Federation (PBF) said. As per PBF's secretary Nasir Tang, Suleman Baloch and Nazeerullah disappeared a couple of hours before the team’s departure for Islamabad. The Pakistan Olympic Association has formed a four-member committee to investigate the matter of the missing boxers.
