349.title: Nitish didn't want to become Bihar CM in 2020, BJP forced him: JD(U) chief
349.article_body: Janata Dal (United) National President Lalan Singh alias RR Singh on Wednesday claimed that Nitish Kumar didn't want to become Bihar CM in 2020. However, BJP compelled Kumar to take the post, Singh said. Ex-Union Minister RCP Singh, who said JD(U) is a sinking ship and resigned from the party on Saturday, came to JD(U) as BJP's agent, Singh added.

350.title: Noodle-like object spotted on Mars identified by NASA
350.article_body: NASA has identified the noodle-like object that was spotted by Perseverance rover last month. The material is a piece of tangled Dacron netting from the entry, descent and landing (EDL) gear that landed the rover on Martian surface, as per NASA. "This particular piece of netting appears to have undergone significant unraveling/shredding, suggesting...it was subjected to strong forces," NASA said.

351.title: Water park accused of racism for cancelling Black teen's party in US
351.article_body: A water park outside US' Kansas City has been accused of racism after reportedly cancelling a Black teenager's birthday party. Chris Evans, who organised the party for his 17-year-old son, said he had signed a $1,900 contract to reserve the facility but the guests were denied entry. A park official reportedly told Evans that she was "uncomfortable" with the party.

352.title: Sri Lanka extends overseas travel ban on ex-PM Rajapaksa till Sept 5
352.article_body: Sri Lanka's Supreme Court on Wednesday extended the overseas travel ban on former Prime Minister Mahinda Rajapaksa and former Finance Minister Basil Rajapaksa till September 5. Mahinda and Basil's brother Gotabaya Rajapaksa, the ex-Sri Lankan President, had fled the country in July amid violent protests. The Rajapaksa family is blamed for the economic crisis in the country.

353.title: US man killed in sand dune collapse while filming sunrise at beach
353.article_body: A 35-year-old man was killed after a sand dune on a beach collapsed on him in US' Florida, authorities said on Monday. The man was believed to have been resting while filming a video of the sunrise. "It was an unusual scene with his feet sticking out of the sand...we had to dig down and find the body," police said.

354.title: Reliance Industries unveils MI Emirates and MI Cape Town franchises
354.article_body: MI owners Reliance Industries today unveiled the name and brand identity of their two new T20 franchises. Their UAE franchise has been named 'MI Emirates', while 'MI Cape Town' is the name of their South African franchise. "'MI Emirates' or phonetically 'MY Emirates' and 'MY Cape Town' respectively, are dedicated to fans across both...Emirates and Cape Town," Reliance said.

355.title: Immigration to Israel from Ukraine and Russia rises amid war
355.article_body: Immigration from Russia and Ukraine to Israel has increased since the outbreak of war in February, official data showed on Wednesday. Over 31,000 people have emigrated to Israel since the start of the invasion. This is 318% higher than a similar period in 2019 when a total of 9,774 new immigrants arrived from the two countries.

356.title: JP Nadda appoints Sunil Bansal as General Secretary of BJP
356.article_body: BJP chief JP Nadda on Wednesday appointed Sunil Bansal as the national General Secretary of the party. Bansal, who was previously the BJP General Secretary in Uttar Pradesh, has also been appointed as the state in-charge of BJP for three opposition-ruled states — West Bengal, Odisha and Telangana. Bansal successfully handled the 2017 and 2022 Assembly elections in Uttar Pradesh.

357.title: Nitish Kumar 'guide' for all who want to change party in 6 months: Assam CM
357.article_body: Assam Chief Minister Himanta Biswa Sarma called Bihar Chief Minister Nitish Kumar a "margdarshak (guide)" for politicians who wish to switch parties every six months. He asked, "How can you guarantee that Nitish Kumar will not leave this coalition after 6-8 months?" Sarma added, "We've also changed political party but we've not changed like him."

358.title: Our car, trees, house have suddenly become illegal: Tyagi's wife
358.article_body: Self-proclaimed BJP leader Shrikant Tyagi's wife, Anu, on Wednesday said that her husband's actions were wrong and he should have apologised. "The topic was that he insulted a woman. It should have been handled like that. But everything is now being dragged. Our car, trees [and] house...[have] suddenly become illegal," Anu added. Earlier, Tyagi's residence was demolished in Noida.

359.title: Sedition charges filed against Imran Khan's aide over comments about army
359.article_body: Sedition charges were filed against a close aide to Pakistan's former Prime Minister Imran Khan after being accused of inciting mutiny in the military during a TV appearance. Shahbaz Gill had accused the military top brass of trying to influence the junior ranks against Khan's party. The comments were aired on ARY TV, which was taken off air this week.

360.title: Thief prays to deity before robbing valuables from temple in MP, video goes viral
360.article_body: A video has gone viral showing a thief praying to the deity before robbing valuables from a temple in Madhya Pradesh. In the video, the thief, who's shirtless, can be seen praying to the deity with his hands folded. After a while, he can be seen stealing the donation box. The act was captured by a CCTV camera.

361.title: Men beaten up by Gurugram club bouncers for opposing alleged molestation of friend
361.article_body: A manager of a multinational company filed a police complaint alleging that bouncers of a Gurugram club beat him and his friends after they confronted one of them for allegedly touching their female friend inappropriately. Police said an FIR has been registered against the bouncers. The bouncers allegedly took away a watch and around ₹12,000 from one of the men.

362.title: Former Twitter employee convicted of spying for Saudi Arabia
362.article_body: Ahmad AbouAmmo, Twitter's ex-media partnership manager for the Middle East region, has been convicted in the US for failing to register as an agent for Saudi Arabia. A jury found him guilty on six counts, including conspiracy to commit wire fraud and money laundering. The case marked the first time Saudi Arabia has been accused of spying in the US.

363.title: J&K LG Manoj Sinha launches key education initiatives
363.article_body: Lieutenant Governor of Jammu and Kashmir, Manoj Sinha, launched several key education initiatives in the Union Territory. Sinha inaugurated 119 civil projects, including 84 school buildings and also laid the foundation stones of two residential schools for tribal students. He said that the new beginning will redefine the teaching-learning process and bring changes in the functioning of schools.

364.title: 3 LeT terrorists killed in an encounter in J&K's Budgam
364.article_body: Three Lashkar-e-Taiba terrorists were killed in an encounter in Jammu and Kashmir's Budgam, the police said. The Additional Director General of Police (ADGP) Kashmir identified one of the terrorists as Lateef Rather, who killed Rahul Bhat and Amreen Bhat, and was involved in several targeted killings. He further added that arms and ammunition, among other incriminating materials were recovered.

365.title: Heavy to very heavy rainfall warning issued for several states, list released
365.article_body: As per IMD's latest bulletin, rainfall with isolated heavy falls and thunderstorm is very likely over Madhya Pradesh and Chhattisgarh till August 14. It's very likely in parts of Maharashtra till August 12 and in Goa till August 13. Heavy rainfall is also predicted over Assam, Meghalaya, Nagaland, Mizoram and Tripura over the next few days.

366.title: Website creator Wix.com to cut costs, lay-off staff amid slow global growth
366.article_body: Wix.com on Wednesday said it aims to cut costs by $150 million/year to compensate for a global economic slowdown and a stronger dollar. Under a three-year plan, Wix said it would take comprehensive cost-cutting measures, including job cuts, aimed at raising free cash flow. About 20% of the annualised savings are expected to be realised already in 2022, Wix added.

367.title: Want a commission on global truce led by PM Modi, Pope: Mexican Prez
367.article_body: Mexican President Andrés Manuel López Obrador said he'll submit a written proposal to the UN to create a commission on global truce led by PM Narendra Modi, Pope Francis and UN Secretary-General Antonio Guterres. The aim of the commission would be to present proposals to stop wars globally and reach an agreement to seek truce for at least five years.

368.title: Vlogger encourages student to try ganja on video chat, held in Kerala
368.article_body: A vlogger from Kerala's Mattancherry was arrested on Tuesday after he encouraged a school girl to try ganja during a video chat, which had surfaced on social media. An excise team, led by Mattancherry Range Inspector V S Pradeep, conducted a search at Francis Nevin Augustine's house and recovered two grams of ganja. The contraband was concealed in Augustine's garments.

369.title: Rubina Dilaik confirms being part of Jhalak Dikhhla Jaa 10
369.article_body: TV actress Rubina Dilaik will be participating in Jhalak Dikhhla Jaa 10. Talking about the show, she said that while she has danced on screen before, performing in front of the judges and "the queen of dance, Madhuri Dixit" will be a challenge. She said she is looking forward to learning new dance styles and improving her dance skills.

370.title: PM Modi inaugurates ₹900-crore 2G ethanol plant in Panipat
370.article_body: PM Narendra Modi on Wednesday inaugurated a 2G (second generation) ethanol plant in Panipat, Haryana. "In our country...biofuel is significant for protecting nature," the PM said. The plant, built at an estimated cost of ₹900 crore by Indian Oil Corporation Limited, aims to utilise about two lakh tonnes of rice straw to generate around three crore litres of ethanol annually.

371.title: Physically challenged man forced to lick feet of another person in Odisha, video surfaces
371.article_body: A video from Mayurbhanj, Odisha shows a physically challenged man being tortured by two people. The clip shows one of the men with a stick forcing the victim to lick the feet of another person. Police said the incident took place at a drug de-addiction centre last year and the two men have been arrested.

372.title: Sri Lankan minister introduces bill to reduce presidential powers
372.article_body: Sri Lankan Justice Minister Wijeyadasa Rajapakshe on Wednesday submitted to the Parliament a constitutional amendment bill that would reduce the powers of the President. The bill, which will undergo debate, must be approved by two-thirds of Sri Lanka's Parliament to become law. A reduction in the President's power was a key demand of protesters.

373.title: Mother slept during 'Tumbbad' premiere, asked me to make good films: Sohum Shah
373.article_body: Actor and producer Sohum Shah revealed his mother fell asleep during the premiere of his film 'Tumbbad' in Venice. "My nephew woke her up," Sohum said. "After coming out, she said, 'Ye kaisi filmein banata hai, kitni darawani film hai, koi dhang ki film banaya kar (why do you make such films, it's scary. Make some good films)'," Sohum said.

374.title: China calls US 'main instigator' of crisis in Ukraine
374.article_body: The Chinese Ambassador to Russia, Zhang Hanhui, has called the US the "main instigator" of the crisis in Ukraine. "Their ultimate goal is to exhaust and crush Russia with a protracted war and the cudgel of sanctions," he added. "Non-intervention in internal affairs is the most fundamental principle of maintaining peace and stability in our world," he further said.

375.title: OYO acquires Danish holiday home operator Bornholmske Feriehuse
375.article_body: Travel and hospitality unicorn OYO has acquired Denmark-based holiday home operator Bornholmske Feriehuse for an undisclosed amount. The acquisition was done by the company's subsidiary, DanCenter, through the 'Invest in Denmark' initiative by the Danish government. Founded by Rasmus Lund and Jacob Lund, Bornholmske Feriehuse provides end-to-end solutions to homeowners and has 737 holiday homes.

376.title: Retention platform CleverTap raises $105 mn in Series D round
376.article_body: Customer engagement and user retention platform CleverTap has raised $105 million in a Series D funding round led by Canada's pension fund CDPQ. IIFL's Asset Management Company (AMC) Tech Fund, along with existing investors Tiger Global and Sequoia India participated in the round. The company valuation was doubled and is now at $775 million from $385 million in October 2019.

377.title: Eyewear platform Lenskart raises $12.57 mn from Manyavar owners
377.article_body: As part of its ongoing funding round, eyewear platform Lenskart has raised $12.57 million from Ravi Modi Family Trust. The fundraise is part of a larger funding round, which has seen participation from Temasek, Avendus Future Leaders Fund, Epiq Capital, among others. The Ravi Modi Family Trust owns brands such as Manyavar, Mohey, and Manthan.

378.title: Agniveer recruitment for female candidates in Bengaluru from Nov 1
378.article_body: The Agniveer recruitment rally for military police under general duty category for female candidates will be held in Bengaluru from November 1 to 3. Candidates from Karnataka, Kerala and the Union Territory of Lakshadweep and Mahe can take part in it. Online registration for the recruitment rally can be done on http://www.joinindianarmy.nic.in from August 10 to September 7.

379.title: 1,000-year-old idols recovered from hideout in Tamil Nadu
379.article_body: Five idols, reportedly around 1,000 years old, were among eight idols recovered from a hideout in Tamil Nadu's Thanjavur district, police said on Wednesday. The 1,000-year-old idols are of Goddess Bogasakti Amman, Lord Buddha, poet Andal and Lord Vishnu. They are worth crores of rupees in the international market, police said, adding a 100-year-old Nataraja idol was also seized.

380.title: Ex-Manchester United star Giggs' alleged abusive text messages to ex-girlfriend surface
380.article_body: The alleged abusive text messages Ryan Giggs sent to his ex-girlfriend Kate Greville, who has accused him of controlling and physically assaulting her, were shown to the court during his trial. "Please unblock me. All this blocking malarkey is poo. Promise, no more naked piccies [pictures]," a message read. "Only an evil, horrible c**t does that," another message read.

381.title: US inflation falls to 8.5%, drops for the first time since April
381.article_body: Amid the falling gas prices, the US' consumer price index rose 8.5% year-over-year in July, according to US' government data. It is down from a 9.1% annual rise in June, which was a 40-year high. Further, it has fallen for the first time since April. On a monthly basis, consumer prices were unchanged, compared to a 1.3% rise in June.

382.title: Forced to buy ₹20 national flag to get ration: Haryana locals
382.article_body: BJP MP Varun Gandhi has shared a video showing ration card holders claiming that they're being forced to buy a national flag for ₹20 to get ration. The video is purportedly from Haryana's Karnal. The video showed a man, reportedly a state-run depot's staffer, saying, "We've been told not to give ration to anyone who refuses to buy the flag."

383.title: Corbevax approved as precaution dose for adults vaccinated with Covaxin, Covishield
383.article_body: Government approved Corbevax COVID-19 vaccine as a precaution dose for those above 18 years. It'll be available as precaution dose after completion of 6 months or 26 weeks from date of administration of second dose of either Covaxin or Covishield. "This enables use of Corbevax as a heterologous COVID-19 vaccine for precaution dose administration in this age group," said government.

384.title: Nitish dumped BJP after his VP ambition was refused: Sushil Modi
384.article_body: BJP leader Sushil Kumar Modi on Wednesday alleged Bihar Chief Minister Nitish Kumar dumped the NDA as his ambition of becoming the country's Vice President could not be accommodated by the BJP. Kumar ended his government's alliance with the BJP in Bihar on Tuesday, joining hands with seven parties to form a 'Mahagathbandhan'. Nitish Kumar's JD(U) refuted Sushil's comments.

385.title: Crimes against humanity being committed in Myanmar: UN probe
385.article_body: Crimes against humanity continue to be systematically committed in Myanmar, with ongoing conflicts severely impacting women and children, according to a UN probe. Children in Myanmar have been tortured, conscripted and arbitrarily detained, it said. Myanmar plunged into a crisis after the removal of a civilian government by the military in February last year.

386.title: BJP wanted to topple J'khand govt, their own collapsed in Bihar: Baghel
386.article_body: Reacting to the end of the JDU-BJP alliance, Chhattisgarh CM Bhupesh Baghel claimed that while BJP wanted to topple the Jharkhand government, it couldn't save its own alliance in Bihar. NDA's allies are leaving, first, it was Akali Dal, then Shiv Sena and now JDU, he added. It's an indication that people have become disillusioned with Centre, he further said.

387.title: Use public transport: Police to Bengaluru flower show visitors
387.article_body: Bengaluru traffic police has urged visitors to the Independence Day Flower Show at Lalbagh Botanical Garden to use public transport. Police said the area was facing traffic congestion. Deputy Commissioner of Police (east Bengaluru), Kala Krishnaswamy, listed the metro station in Lal Bagh, the bus stand at Lal Bagh main gate, Shantinagar bus stand and Siddapura bus stand as options.

388.title: Nandita Das is the most hardworking director: Kapil Sharma
388.article_body: Comedian-turned-actor Kapil Sharma on Wednesday penned an appreciation post for director Nandita Das. Sharing a couple of photos on Instagram, Kapil wrote, "Me with my most hardworking, most talented, actor, writer, and pagal director." Kapil will be seen playing a food delivery partner in Nandita Das' untitled directorial. It will also star Shahana Goswami.

389.title: Some call dowry a 'gift' or 'sankalp', I call it 'extortion': Akshay Kumar
389.article_body: Akshay Kumar, who portrays the role of a brother struggling to get his four sisters married in his upcoming film 'Raksha Bandhan', said the film throws light on dowry practices in India. "Dowry is very much there in India...Some call it...'gift', 'sankalp'. It has different names. Some demand...to have the wedding on...large scale. I would call it extortion," Akshay said.

390.title: Police bust drug manufacturing unit in Hyderabad, 2 arrested
390.article_body: A drug manufacturing unit was raided in Hyderabad and large quantities of psychotropic substances were seized and two people who were involved in preparing and supplying narcotic substances were arrested, the police said. Police seized 53 grams of synthetic drugs and 3.6 kilograms of ephedrine, among other materials. One of the accused worked as a senior chemist.

391.title: China withdraws promise not to send troops to Taiwan if it takes control
391.article_body: China has withdrawn a promise not to send troops or administrators to Taiwan if it takes control of the island, an official document showed. The move signals a decision by President Xi Jinping to grant less autonomy than previously offered, Reuters said. Previously, China had proposed that Taiwan could return to its rule under a "one country, two systems" model.

392.title: CBI makes first arrests in Bengal SSC scam case as 2 top officials nabbed
392.article_body: CBI has made its first arrests in connection with the West Bengal school recruitment scam case. Those who were arrested are identified as Shanti Prasad Sinha, convenor of the special advisory committee formed for the appointments, and ex-secretary of the state School Service Commission Ashok Saha. Former minister Partha Chatterjee and his aide were arrested in this case in July.

393.title: Vrindavan widows send 501 handmade rakhis to PM Modi on Raksha Bandhan
393.article_body: Widows of UP's Vrindavan have sent 501 'rakhis' and 75 national flags to PM Narendra Modi on Raksha Bandhan. These rakhis will be delivered to the PM's office by a representative of the organisation, said the media advisor of Sulabh International Madan Jha. He further added that some women have tied a rakhi to the PM previously.

394.title: Consumer prices in US unchanged in July due to fall in gasoline cost
394.article_body: The US consumer price index was unchanged in July, the Labor Department said on Wednesday, compared with the 1.3% gain in the prior month. This comes amid fall in gasoline prices. Economists polled by The Wall Street Journal had estimated a 0.2% advance in July. Energy prices fell 4.6% in July, with gasoline prices down 7.7%.

395.title: Those believing in black magic won’t earn people's trust: PM on Cong
395.article_body: Referring to the Opposition's protest in black dresses on August 5, PM Narendra Modi on Wednesday said those who believe in black magic will never be able to earn the trust of people. "Even after repeatedly spreading lies against the government, the public is not ready to trust such people," PM Modi further said.

396.title: CEO's crying selfie on LinkedIn after firing employees goes viral, sparks debate
396.article_body: Braden Wallake, CEO of HyperSocial, posted a photo of himself crying while trying to explain why he had to fire some of his employees. Calling it the "most vulnerable thing" he'll ever share, Wallake wrote on LinkedIn, "I can't...think of...a lower moment than this." While some appreciated Wallake, others criticised him and wrote, "The post...would've done well without the picture."

397.title: G20 summit is opportunity to introduce 'Brand UP' to world: CM Yogi
397.article_body: UP CM Yogi Adityanath on Tuesday termed next year's G20 summit, which will be held in India, as an opportunity to introduce 'Brand UP' to the world. According to an official release, CM Adityanath has directed officials to prepare a comprehensive action plan for summit. "We have to...present the cultural, spiritual, social, economic and industrial characteristics of [UP]," he said.

398.title: Bat coronaviruses infect 66,000 people each year, pose pandemic risk: Study
398.article_body: As per a study, bat coronaviruses infect thousands of people every year in Southeast Asia, posing a risk of pandemic. "Our estimate that...approx 66,000 people are infected with SARSr-CoVs each year in Southeast Asia suggests that bat-to-human SARSr-CoV spillover is common in the region...[it's] undetected by surveillance programs and clinical studies in...majority of cases," the study stated.

399.title: 36-yr-old bike rider dies as electric pole falls on him in Palghar
399.article_body: Yogesh Pagdhare, a 36-year-old contractual employee, died after an unmaintained electric pole fell on him while he was riding his bike to work in Tarapur MIDC industrial area. Pagdhare died after passersby took him to the hospital and his condition began deteriorating. The pole is in shabby condition from its bottom and no concrete support was maintained, local residents said.

400.title: Rajapaksa wants to visit country, he isn't seeking asylum: Thailand
400.article_body: Thailand's Foreign Ministry on Wednesday confirmed it has received a request for ex-Sri Lankan President Gotabaya Rajapaksa to visit the country, adding that he isn't seeking asylum. Thailand has no problem with Rajapaksa entering on a diplomatic passport, which would allow him to stay 90 days, ministry spokesman Tanee Sangrat said. Rajapaksa is currently in Singapore on short-term visa pass.
